[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-12 19:54:09.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/hooks.py', 'setup.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': "Update build hooks.

The pbr setup_hook has not been needed for a while, so remove it.  The
neutron hook has been broken for a while: it places a setup_requires
build dependency on everything in neutron/__init__.py, which is
non-empty, but setup_requires is handled by easy install so we try
very hard to avoid it. Instead, we can use environment markers to
selectively include the win32 dependencies without requiring that
neutron be importable during setup.py execution. This is unusual
in OpenStack and will eventually be moved to a regular
requirements.txt dependency with the same marker - once we've finished
the integration work to make markers work properly in
requirements.txt.

Change-Id: Icdc403a3ccf06daeccf2a907a7bfeafd8dbbb5dd
"}]
commit_message:
Update build hooks.

The pbr setup_hook has not been needed for a while, so remove it.  The
neutron hook has been broken for a while: it places a setup_requires
build dependency on everything in neutron/__init__.py, which is
non-empty, but setup_requires is handled by easy install so we try
very hard to avoid it. Instead, we can use environment markers to
selectively include the win32 dependencies without requiring that
neutron be importable during setup.py execution. This is unusual
in OpenStack and will eventually be moved to a regular
requirements.txt dependency with the same marker - once we've finished
the integration work to make markers work properly in
requirements.txt.

Change-Id: Icdc403a3ccf06daeccf2a907a7bfeafd8dbbb5dd

commit_message:
Fix dnsmasq lease lost upon restart

Generate fake lease during startup of dnsmasq for each entry in
hosts file, with the help of --dhcp-script init function.

Change-Id: I8230dc0ee30efef236b6827dd7116aba88df79de
Closes-Bug: 1345947

subject: Explain how to adopt a backlog spec
revisions:

Now that we are starting to get backlog specs, make it clear how one can
take it over and implement it.

* Make it clear on the landing page that backlog specs are looking for
  owners. Hopefully this will guide developers looking for a spec to

* Explain how to take over a backlog spec.

Change-Id: Ia3585c515c115e073c00e3222fc6718da79792b9
'}]
commit_message:
Explain how to adopt a backlog spec

Now that we are starting to get backlog specs, make it clear how one can
take it over and implement it.

* Make it clear on the landing page that backlog specs are looking for
  owners. Hopefully this will guide developers looking for a spec to
  work in to the right place.
* Explain how to take over a backlog spec.

Change-Id: Ia3585c515c115e073c00e3222fc6718da79792b9

commit_message:
OVS-agent: Ignore IPv6 addresses for ARP spoofing prevention

The flow rules to match on ARP headers for spoofing prevention
fail to install when an IPv6 address is used. These should be
skipped since the ARP spoofing prevention doesn't apply to IPv6.

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/common/machine_fixtures.py

Co-authored-by: Kevin Benton <blak111@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1449363
Change-Id: I4bb3135e62378c5c96d1ac0b646336ac9a637bde
(cherry picked from commit dbe7ba1868f35af0142f78c70693ed69e6f42ca3)

commit_message:
Add standard QoS spec support to cDOT drivers

This commit adds support for standard cinder QoS specs to
NetApp cDOT drivers, alongside our pre-existing support for
externally provisioned QoS policy groups via qualified
extra specs.

Implements-blueprint: add-qos-spec-support

Change-Id: I4bd123020d00866a346ad02919ac1d82f7236134

subject: post-deploy hook for rhel registration
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-05-07 20:55:43.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/post_deploy/rhel-registration/environment-rhel-registration.yaml', 'extraconfig/post_deploy/rhel-registration/scripts/rhel-registration', 'extraconfig/post_deploy/rhel-registration/rhel-registration.yaml', 'extraconfig/post_deploy/rhel-registration/scripts/rhel-unregistration', 'extraconfig/post_deploy/rhel-registration/rhel-registration-resource-registry.yaml'], 'message': 'post-deploy hook for rhel registration

Adds a potential usage of the post-deploy hooks to register a server
with RHN or a satellite.

Note this requires some additional parameters, which can be specified in
environment_rhel_reg.yaml, and this must be passed into the call to heat
via another -e parameter.  An alternative may be to have a global
extraconfig_env.yaml at the top level, which the scripts always pass, or
to use the global environment (/etc/heat/environment.d/default.yaml) on
the seed.

Co-Authored-By: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia6fd270122cbc2e51beb672654e5e1ebd3bd2966
'}]
commit_message:
post-deploy hook for rhel registration

Adds a potential usage of the post-deploy hooks to register a server
with RHN or a satellite.

Note this requires some additional parameters, which can be specified in
environment_rhel_reg.yaml, and this must be passed into the call to heat
via another -e parameter.  An alternative may be to have a global
extraconfig_env.yaml at the top level, which the scripts always pass, or
to use the global environment (/etc/heat/environment.d/default.yaml) on
the seed.

Co-Authored-By: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia6fd270122cbc2e51beb672654e5e1ebd3bd2966

commit_message:
Remove requirements_style_check.sh

Per mordred, requirements should be listed in the order they
need to be installed, since pip doesn't "fix" anything listed
in the wrong order.

See also https://review.openstack.org/#/c/92221/

Conflicts:
	requirements.txt

Change-Id: I467a3e597ffca24de01ed3d6bcbc26bd1501353b
(cherry picked from commit 93db699a99793288464fe56de27bcf676fcedd17)

commit_message:
Fix launch-instance dialog when using Postgres

When using Postgres as backend DB for Cinder, searching for bootable=1
does not work:

Caught error: (ProgrammingError) operator does not exist: boolean =
integer

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-29 16:22:39.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/static/muranodashboard/css/reports.css', 'muranodashboard/environments/tabs.py', 'muranodashboard/templates/deployments/_logs.html', 'muranodashboard/environments/consts.py', 'muranodashboard/templates/deployments/reports.html'], 'message': 'Improved layout of deployments/_logs.html

Before logs were displayed in a pre tag and to add colors autoescape was
turned off. This leads to potential security vulnerability, because
reports can potentially include malicious js code.

This pactch puts back autoescape, improves the layout,
while preserving the look and feel of the original logs tab,
including color highlights. All the layout logic is moved from python

Change-Id: Ice0101678ff50f00306b69c301f7b4177c584ca1
Closes-Bug: #1460075
'}]
commit_message:
Improved layout of deployments/_logs.html

Before logs were displayed in a pre tag and to add colors autoescape was
turned off. This leads to potential security vulnerability, because
reports can potentially include malicious js code.

This pactch puts back autoescape, improves the layout,
while preserving the look and feel of the original logs tab,
including color highlights. All the layout logic is moved from python
code to html template and css files.

Change-Id: Ice0101678ff50f00306b69c301f7b4177c584ca1
Closes-Bug: #1460075

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-27 19:05:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/openstack/common/strutils.py', 'nova/openstack/common/log.py'], 'message': 'Sync strutils from oslo-incubator for mask_password fix

This sync pulls in:
   1131b56 Enable mask_password to handle byte code strings

This is needed because Nova commands are hitting the same
problem Cinder was hitting in bug 1368527 which was fixed
by this strutils update in bug 1366189.

This is not needed in kilo because in kilo Nova has moved
to using the oslo.utils library, which has this fix in it.

NOTE(jecarey):
This is now needed in stable/icehouse because of the backport of:
   f58d95c9 - Sync process and str utils from oslo
which was to address CVE-2014-7231 (bug #1345233)

Note that during icehouse mask_password was moved from
oslo-incubator log.py to strutils.py, however both still exist and
are used.  In order to minimize change, this patch also updates
the original nova/openstack/common/log.py.

Closes-bug: #1366189
Change-Id: I983feea4ac26e34032fa66a4b55f0ce42699ba6a
(cherry picked from commit 0bad3b14abe54926b73acdab8e9b31cae4a87e47)
'}]
commit_message:
Sync strutils from oslo-incubator for mask_password fix

This sync pulls in:
   1131b56 Enable mask_password to handle byte code strings

This is needed because Nova commands are hitting the same
problem Cinder was hitting in bug 1368527 which was fixed
by this strutils update in bug 1366189.

This is not needed in kilo because in kilo Nova has moved
to using the oslo.utils library, which has this fix in it.

NOTE(jecarey):
This is now needed in stable/icehouse because of the backport of:
   f58d95c9 - Sync process and str utils from oslo
which was to address CVE-2014-7231 (bug #1345233)

Note that during icehouse mask_password was moved from
oslo-incubator log.py to strutils.py, however both still exist and
are used.  In order to minimize change, this patch also updates
the original nova/openstack/common/log.py.

Closes-bug: #1366189
Change-Id: I983feea4ac26e34032fa66a4b55f0ce42699ba6a
(cherry picked from commit 0bad3b14abe54926b73acdab8e9b31cae4a87e47)

subject: Escape app names, returned to horizon modal forms
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-31 23:55:30.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/catalog/views.py'], 'message': 'Escape app names, returned to horizon modal forms

When adding an app to the environment via plus button on the form of
another app an ajax request is made by horizon js code, to get the name
of the app, that was just added to env. Name of the app can contain
malicious code (alternatively the code can be present in the initial
value of the name).

This patch escapes name, returned during that request.

Change-Id: I31f63ed1aa0d46496978110f45c7b43a04519970
Closes-Bug: #1460493
'}]
commit_message:
Escape app names, returned to horizon modal forms

When adding an app to the environment via plus button on the form of
another app an ajax request is made by horizon js code, to get the name
of the app, that was just added to env. Name of the app can contain
malicious code (alternatively the code can be present in the initial
value of the name).

This patch escapes name, returned during that request.

Change-Id: I31f63ed1aa0d46496978110f45c7b43a04519970
Closes-Bug: #1460493

Pillow can be used by Django for the ImageField and versions < 2.7.0
shouldn't be used (see CVE-2014-9601).
So allow at least version greater that 2.4.0

Change-Id: I585647eb605fb913e86cce98b4b61116954f1dad
"}]
commit_message:
Relax Pillow requirement

Pillow can be used by Django for the ImageField and versions < 2.7.0
shouldn't be used (see CVE-2014-9601).
So allow at least version greater that 2.4.0

Change-Id: I585647eb605fb913e86cce98b4b61116954f1dad

phrase - '*** UPGRADE DONE SUCCESSFULLY' but
it has been changed to

commit_message:
Switch from MySQL-python to PyMySQL

As discussed in the Liberty Design Summit "Moving apps to Python 3"
cross-project workshop, the way forward in the near future is to
switch to the pure-python PyMySQL library as a default.

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/liberty-cross-project-python3

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-05-02 08:21:43.000000000', 'files': ['doc/image-guide/section_fedora-example.xml'], 'message': 'Update Fedora image VM guide example to F21

Rewrite Fedora image example. The latest Fedora 21 comes with dedicated for
cloud usage images. These images provide a base system dedicated for use in
public and private cloud environments. These are cloud-init enabled striped
versions of Fedora. Prior to version 21, to cloudify Fedora images, it was
necessary to perform full manual installation outside of OpenStack, perform
specific configuration and manually cloud-init installation. New Fedora Cloud
images do not require any additional modification and are ready to use. Old
complicated procedure for F20 become irrelevant for F21.

Change-Id: I4c135e2a82f33cbd5fe618e3a34b7a9ab00e11fd
Closes-bug: #1443815
'}]
commit_message:
Update Fedora image VM guide example to F21

Rewrite Fedora image example. The latest Fedora 21 comes with dedicated for
cloud usage images. These images provide a base system dedicated for use in
public and private cloud environments. These are cloud-init enabled striped
versions of Fedora. Prior to version 21, to cloudify Fedora images, it was
necessary to perform full manual installation outside of OpenStack, perform
specific configuration and manually cloud-init installation. New Fedora Cloud
images do not require any additional modification and are ready to use. Old
complicated procedure for F20 become irrelevant for F21.

Change-Id: I4c135e2a82f33cbd5fe618e3a34b7a9ab00e11fd
Closes-bug: #1443815

Fix devlibs for SUSE

libmysqld-devel is needed for installing MySQL-python. Otherwise the
following error occurs:

EnvironmentError: mysql_config not found

commit_message:
Fixing sending the result of subworkflow

 * This is why retry didn't work for subworkflow
 * Engine commands such as fail or succeed doesn't send the
   result of current workflow to parent workflow if needed.

Closes-Bug: #1449298

Change-Id: Ia0d87160a51f53a686ca0451a2000298cec5a929

commit_message:
API: remove admin require for compute_node_create/update/delete from db layer

This patch removes require_admin_context decorator for compute_node_create
compute_node_update, compute_node_delete.

The 3 methods are not called by any REST api method but only nova code.

Partially implements bp nova-api-policy-final-part

Change-Id: If15ee5158d2251dafd45f96eb1f0992562f6ba2d

[{'number': 16, 'created': '2015-05-12 03:13:34.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_hosts.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/hosts.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/hosts.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "API: remove admin require from compute_node_get_all_by_* from db layer

This patch removes require_admin_context decorator from db api, we can safely
remove them because of:

1. compute_nodes_get_by_service_id:
    * called by get_by_host_and_nodename which is used by nove(it's admin
context)
    * called by build_and_run_instance if user require a specify node, they
should be an admin.

2. compute_node_get_by_host_and_nodename:
    same with compute_nodes_get_by_service_id.

3. compute_node_get_all_by_host:
    hosts.py->show() method, for v2.1 we have admin_api in policy.json,
for v2, add hard code in rest api for backward-compatible.

Partially implements bp nova-api-policy-final-part
Change-Id: If31c2fd262dd94bb8041f6ae92fc949df14b338a
"}]
commit_message:
API: remove admin require from compute_node_get_all_by_* from db layer

This patch removes require_admin_context decorator from db api, we can safely
remove them because of:

1. compute_nodes_get_by_service_id:
    * called by get_by_host_and_nodename which is used by nove(it's admin
context)
    * called by build_and_run_instance if user require a specify node, they
should be an admin.

2. compute_node_get_by_host_and_nodename:
    same with compute_nodes_get_by_service_id.

3. compute_node_get_all_by_host:
    hosts.py->show() method, for v2.1 we have admin_api in policy.json,
for v2, add hard code in rest api for backward-compatible.

Partially implements bp nova-api-policy-final-part
Change-Id: If31c2fd262dd94bb8041f6ae92fc949df14b338a

commit_message:
API: remove instance_get_all_by_host(_and_node) hard-code admin check from db

This patch removes require_admin_context decorator for instance_get_all_by_host
and instance_get_all_by_host_and_node from db api, will add back-compatible in
v2 REST api layer, for v2.1 we have policy rule to do this checking.

Partially implements bp nova-api-policy-final-part
Change-Id: Ibec6cc8299d5b2678e4e6c17c6fe2f47a23e9061

commit_message:
Test importing a package by URL

Sets up an httpd SimpleHttpServer, that serves files from a temporary
directory. Package is then put into that directory and imported from it
by url. Directory is removed afterwards.
Includes small speed-ups for tests and improvements for test code
robustness.

Change-Id: I28e70350279daf4ab9b20959d060ca48ffb9162f

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-05-28 18:10:22.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/cmd/manage.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_cmd.py'], 'message': "Updating cmd/manage.py get_arg_string() argument parser and adding unit test

Looks like get_arg_string() would improperly chop off the first two characters
of an argument that was passed in with one dash.  For example,
passing '-option foo' would return 'tion foo' instead of 'option foo'.

Change-Id: Ib9aee601711b22c5243aca35f5c6196f494d23a9
Closes-Bug: #1459453
"}]
commit_message:
Updating cmd/manage.py get_arg_string() argument parser and adding unit test

Looks like get_arg_string() would improperly chop off the first two characters
of an argument that was passed in with one dash.  For example,
passing '-option foo' would return 'tion foo' instead of 'option foo'.

Change-Id: Ib9aee601711b22c5243aca35f5c6196f494d23a9
Closes-Bug: #1459453

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-31 20:30:31.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp'], 'message': 'Neutron: Remove hiera lookup to controller_host

With current effort of creating isolated networks, the controller_host
hiera variable does not exist anymore. Hence we remove it else the
lookup will fail.

The hiera binding neutron::agents::ml2::ovs::local_ip has been written
in another review[1]

[1] I1dc11987b4ea3c37775b14fbdddb75588499e9bb

Change-Id: I12777c512d379210e5cddb5e683be4d79808fa2c
'}]
commit_message:
Neutron: Remove hiera lookup to controller_host

With current effort of creating isolated networks, the controller_host
hiera variable does not exist anymore. Hence we remove it else the
lookup will fail.

The hiera binding neutron::agents::ml2::ovs::local_ip has been written
in another review[1]

[1] I1dc11987b4ea3c37775b14fbdddb75588499e9bb

Change-Id: I12777c512d379210e5cddb5e683be4d79808fa2c

commit_message:
Replaced setting run_pause with standard interval

The deprecated directive `run_pause` should be replaced with the more
standard one `interval`. The `run_pause` should be still supported for
backward compatibility. This patch updates object replicator to use
`interval` and support `run_pause`. It also updates its sample config
and documentation.

Co-Authored-By: Joanna H. Huang <joanna.huitzu.huang@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kamil Rykowski <kamil.rykowski@intel.com>

Change-Id: Ie2a3414a96a94efb9273ff53a80b9d90c74fff09
Closes-Bug: #1364735

commit_message:
Fix TemplateDoesNotExist at manage/unmanage volumes

manage/unmanage template includes wrong templates:

project/volumes/volumes/_unmanage_volume.html
project/volumes/volumes/_manage_volume.html

it should be admin/volumes/... instead of project/volumes/...

Change-Id: Ic1b16077630b39b8a72e773c562de2c65a5a11c3
Closes-Bug: #1459625
(cherry picked from commit c5b287ebf24df478c9aeea47840da197c6e5a2d6)

commit_message:
Catalog Index Service - Client

Implements: blueprint TBD

Provide CLI support for search service by adding commands to operate on
Glance Search API. Following commands has been introduced:

* index-search - used to search for resources across different indices
and types.
* index-manage - used to manage resources stored in search engine.
Provides a way to create, update and delete documents.

Change-Id: Ieface6b23d77eaf36fd5fae962c9959d7e2b1a30

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-28 16:22:32.000000000', 'files': ['manila/api/v1/security_service.py', 'manila/tests/api/v1/test_security_service.py'], 'message': 'Fix policy check for API 'security service update'

Manila API for update of security service reads policy for "show" operation
but should do it for "update" operation.

commit_message:
Fix policy check for API 'security service update'

Manila API for update of security service reads policy for "show" operation
but should do it for "update" operation.

Change-Id: I675f834fcb75f3b7864094601e47c15f60a0864b
Closes-Bug: #1459631

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-26 14:55:32.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py'], 'message': 'Display NOTIFICATIONS on assert failure

From time to time we have itermitent errors regarding the
fake_notifier.NOTIFICATIONS count.

This patch does two things to try to find out which notifications are
being fired unexpectedly:
- Make sure that fake_notifier is reset in cleanup regardless of
  exception raised by shutil.rmtree
- Display fake_notifier.NOTIFICATIONS whenever count assertion fails.

Related-Bug: #1412513
Change-Id: I07370636d8b30098dcb2a70ef1985c2f5aee81be
'}]
commit_message:
Display NOTIFICATIONS on assert failure

From time to time we have itermitent errors regarding the
fake_notifier.NOTIFICATIONS count.

This patch does two things to try to find out which notifications are
being fired unexpectedly:
- Make sure that fake_notifier is reset in cleanup regardless of
  exception raised by shutil.rmtree
- Display fake_notifier.NOTIFICATIONS whenever count assertion fails.

Related-Bug: #1412513
Change-Id: I07370636d8b30098dcb2a70ef1985c2f5aee81be

commit_message:
Remove unused attr status from models

Models "security_services" and "network_allocations" have attr "status" that is
not used indeed. So, remove it from models and add appropriate migrations.

Closes-Bug: #1459660
Change-Id: Idb3a69916e8052b16c9daebb9bb67b09d1714c46

revisions:

After heat engine starts, it won't report its status, so
updated_at is None by then. If heat engine die before its first
status report, its record will not remove from service-list.

Change-Id: I55801ceb12ec8e4a3746799d3d43c6e9c01c6cd8
Closes-Bug: #1459997
"}]
commit_message:
Report status when engine start

After heat engine starts, it won't report its status, so
updated_at is None by then. If heat engine die before its first
status report, its record will not remove from service-list.

Change-Id: I55801ceb12ec8e4a3746799d3d43c6e9c01c6cd8
Closes-Bug: #1459997

commit_message:
Show the right request body in v2 port update api.

Divide the file port_create_or_update_req.json/xml into 2 different
sample files, named port_create_req.json/xml and port_update_req.json/xml.
And show the right example like others api showed.

Closes-bug:#1460500

commit_message:
Ignore cover directory

When the coverage report is generated, it's put into the cover
directory. This should be ignored by git so it's not accidentally
checked in.

Change-Id: I2569b73ab5da1f7b3bb895507b5bbb02b83d6ccb

commit_message:
Passing posargs to flake8

By passing posargs to flake8, we can now test pep8 of a single file by passing
file name, eg:

    tox -e pep8 magnum/common/service.py

Closes-Bug: #1460495
Change-Id: I8e143b25719c6b375dbd9fc550809f417509e65c

commit_message:
Disable cloud-watch-lite by default

This has been deprecated for years and is incompatible with deploying
multiple heat-engine processes. Let's at least not turn it on by default.

Change-Id: Iabddbd65be9000a30a5714b26658ea6acea0e103

commit_message:
Notification with volume and snapshot metadata

Now notify message to ceilometer do not contain volume
metadata/glance_metadata and snapshot metadata, which are
useful to bill and enrich resource information in ceilometer.

This feature will add the metadata/glance_metadata of volume
and metadata of snapshot to notification usage info.

Change-Id: I04097be9f2da1d6bc45a2d5770bcd543a3f41887
Implements: blueprint notification-with-volume-and-snapshot-metadata

subject: Fix translation setup
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-27 09:44:49.000000000', 'files': ['python-magnumclient/locale/python-magnumclient.pot', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Fix translation setup

The infra scripts really expect $REPODIR/locale to work, fix
setup.cfg and rename the locale file so that infra scripts work.

This fixes change Id9f5b08835a4780a8448c989a878c03b70a97803 which
already said:"The proper place is for all python projects
$PROJECT/locale/$PROJECT.pot - see setup.cfg." - but then during review
we missed that instead of PROJECT=python-magnumclient, it used
magnumclient - and the infra scripts do not cope with that since
PROJECT really has to be the name of the repository.

Change-Id: Idc5efe52a1ff1b0cb8599e1258e411522547f0e4
'}]
commit_message:
Fix translation setup

The infra scripts really expect $REPODIR/locale to work, fix
setup.cfg and rename the locale file so that infra scripts work.

This fixes change Id9f5b08835a4780a8448c989a878c03b70a97803 which
already said:"The proper place is for all python projects
$PROJECT/locale/$PROJECT.pot - see setup.cfg." - but then during review
we missed that instead of PROJECT=python-magnumclient, it used
magnumclient - and the infra scripts do not cope with that since
PROJECT really has to be the name of the repository.

Change-Id: Idc5efe52a1ff1b0cb8599e1258e411522547f0e4

subject: Move validation logic out of drivers and managers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-30 19:11:53.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/assignment/controllers.py', 'keystone/identity/core.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'keystone/assignment/backends/sql.py', 'keystone/assignment/core.py', 'keystone/identity/controllers.py', 'test-requirements-py3.txt', 'keystone/assignment/backends/ldap.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/ldap.py'], 'message': 'Move validation logic out of drivers and managers

Prior to having jsonschema validate incoming requests for Keystone,
there were several different ways to validate input from the user. The
keystone/clean.py module was one of the ways this was done.

From a Keystone V3 perspective, we handle all validation with jsonschema
at the controller layer. With keystone/clean.py, these calls are
scattered throughout the Keystone stack, some in the backends, and some
in the managers, for the Keystone v2.0 API. This commit is an attempt to
standardize a place for keystone/clean.py calls in general, if and only
if we need them, since they are only for v2.0 calls.

Change-Id: I336f641edc82e92cd962f333b841a623635f4400
Related-Bug: #1387607
'}]
commit_message:
Move validation logic out of drivers and managers

Prior to having jsonschema validate incoming requests for Keystone,
there were several different ways to validate input from the user. The
keystone/clean.py module was one of the ways this was done.

From a Keystone V3 perspective, we handle all validation with jsonschema
at the controller layer. With keystone/clean.py, these calls are
scattered throughout the Keystone stack, some in the backends, and some
in the managers, for the Keystone v2.0 API. This commit is an attempt to
standardize a place for keystone/clean.py calls in general, if and only
if we need them, since they are only for v2.0 calls.

Change-Id: I336f641edc82e92cd962f333b841a623635f4400
Related-Bug: #1387607

the same hanging distance to argument1.

If you put argument1 in the second line, the hanging distance should
always be four.

obj.method(

    argument2,
    ...

problems. See below for more details

https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0008/#indentation

commit_message:
Fix continuation line under/over indented problems

When you are writing a multiple method invocation (or other similar
syntax)

```
obj.method(argument1,
           argument2,
           ...)
```

If you put argument1 in the first line, the following lines should have
the same hanging distance to argument1.

If you put argument1 in the second line, the hanging distance should
always be four.

```
obj.method(
    argument1,
    argument2,
    ...
)
```

Otherwise PEP8 would complain for continuation line under/over indented
problems. See below for more details

https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0008/#indentation

This patch fixes all the continuation line indentation problems and
enables related checks in tox.ini.

Closes-bug: #1459514
Change-Id: I80995c2ae71b817ad78a87ab7c567f0d36112710

commit_message:
Add timeout parameter to execute

Add an optional timeout parameter to execute() function of
oslo_concurrency.processutils. Timeout is 0 means infinity,
which is the default.

Add new tests.

This changeset does not change the default behaviour.

Closes-Bug: #1448227

Change-Id: I0dfdf5b28ad26b2255c76a0b5c4c1ced1f813216

commit_message:
Enable random hash seeds

Neutron tests have been updated in order to support random hash seed. It
allows to remove PYTHONHASHSEED=0 in tox.ini and remove hashtest tox
environment.

Closes-Bug: #1348818

commit_message:
Update functional tox env requirements

The functional tox env requirements were in tox.ini, so they weren't
being updated automatically and were out of date.

The functional tox env requirements are moved to
test-requirements-functional.txt so that they'll be updated
automatically and the requirements are updated to the
requirements as of 8cb51513 .

Change-Id: I90ff294914487d6beee5564c2c541f7f77bb3361

We don't have OpenStack Documentation for kilo written by docs team.

"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Change the structure of Ironic's developer documentation (Don't Merge)

We don't have OpenStack Documentation for kilo written by docs team.
So for Admins, we should keep the Install Guide etc for stable/kilo.

On the other hand, we should also keep the Developer Install Guide for master.

We should create a branch of guide for stable/kilo other than
what we maintain for master.

Change-Id: Iaaf2b4d04adb113be1177623f94a524838bb89ec

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-05-30 04:59:46.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_securitygroup.py'], 'message': "Removed duplicate keys in dicts in test

Test test_create_security_group_rule_invalid_ethertype_for_prefix
contained dict with duplicate keys, remote ip prefixes.

Test was successful because incorrect items for tests were overwitten:

'192.168.1.1/24': 'ipv4'  by '192.168.1.1/24': 'IPv6'
'2001:db8:1234::/48': 'ipv6' by '2001:db8:1234::/48': 'IPv4'

This patch removes incorrect and useless items for tests.
Also added additional item with invalid ethertype.

Change-Id: I29cd2b843a7905986de13a1ecfba0cb5797ccaf8
"}]
commit_message:
Removed duplicate keys in dicts in test

Test test_create_security_group_rule_invalid_ethertype_for_prefix
contained dict with duplicate keys, remote ip prefixes.

Test was successful because incorrect items for tests were overwitten:

'192.168.1.1/24': 'ipv4'  by '192.168.1.1/24': 'IPv6'
'2001:db8:1234::/48': 'ipv6' by '2001:db8:1234::/48': 'IPv4'

This patch removes incorrect and useless items for tests.
Also added additional item with invalid ethertype.

Change-Id: I29cd2b843a7905986de13a1ecfba0cb5797ccaf8

commit_message:
Check only for added/deleted metadata entries

Utilize the same methodology as test_volume_metadata and only check
for presence or absence of metadata entries explicitily touched on
the snapshot.

Update_snapshot_metadata requires testing for exact match (it
replaces, not appends).

Change-Id: I2be45ff13997269b39de85d16ccaea3504e972cc
Closes-Bug: 1379460

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-27 17:00:48.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/volume/test_volume_metadata.py'], 'message': "Verify exact match for volume metadata update.

Test_update_volume_metadata completely replaces a volume's existing
metadata with a new set, discarding any existing values.  Change the
assertion check to an exact match, not merely contains(), to ensure
that no stale metadata is present after update_all.

Change-Id: I1d363cfa65cb7c76fae9cfabaa499dcdf7c8b0ca
Closes-Bug: 1459351
"}]
commit_message:
Verify exact match for volume metadata update.

Test_update_volume_metadata completely replaces a volume's existing
metadata with a new set, discarding any existing values.  Change the
assertion check to an exact match, not merely contains(), to ensure
that no stale metadata is present after update_all.

Change-Id: I1d363cfa65cb7c76fae9cfabaa499dcdf7c8b0ca
Closes-Bug: 1459351

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-29 10:50:33.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/network/test_networks.py'], 'message': 'Do not consider subnets of shared public nets

Test test_external_network_visibility in
tempest.api.network.test_network fails when running
tempest against a deployment with public networks which
are shared among non-admin tenants.

This patch skips the public networks whose shared
property is set to true, as their subnets will be visible to
non-admin tenants.

Change-Id: Ieafb8e4094e603e259d68c4f485194a602dfc0cf
Closes-Bug: #1425962
'}]
commit_message:
Do not consider subnets of shared public nets

Test test_external_network_visibility in
tempest.api.network.test_network fails when running
tempest against a deployment with public networks which
are shared among non-admin tenants.

This patch skips the public networks whose shared
property is set to true, as their subnets will be visible to
non-admin tenants.

Change-Id: Ieafb8e4094e603e259d68c4f485194a602dfc0cf
Closes-Bug: #1425962

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-28 03:14:29.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/rabbitmq_server/templates/rabbitmq.config.j2', 'playbooks/roles/rabbitmq_server/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Set Rabbit recovery method for network partitions

Adds configurable option rabbit_cluster_partition_handling with default
value of pause_minority. Allows option to be explicitly set to ignore
through Ansible to reset to prior (and RabbitMQ default) behavior.

Closes-Bug: #1454860
(cherry picked from commit af1b69cb1e7f456e19b391802097fe8d59a4ff1c)

Change-Id: Ife58b94142bc0a846da5c0db854c5852f318730a
'}]
commit_message:
Set Rabbit recovery method for network partitions

Adds configurable option rabbit_cluster_partition_handling with default
value of pause_minority. Allows option to be explicitly set to ignore
through Ansible to reset to prior (and RabbitMQ default) behavior.

Closes-Bug: #1454860
(cherry picked from commit af1b69cb1e7f456e19b391802097fe8d59a4ff1c)

Change-Id: Ife58b94142bc0a846da5c0db854c5852f318730a

commit_message:
Volume replication enablement for IBM storwize/SVC

Add replication support to IBM storwize/SVC driver.
Supports replication modes:
1. Metro Mirror
2. Global Mirror

WIP: Unit test, reenable_replcation will be added

Change-Id: I77dc2e7221544c5d355671710a48a7ca61afbeff

commit_message:
Add support for volume v2 API

Added following commands for volume V2 API:
volume show
volume delete
volume type show
volume type delete
snapshot show
snapshot delete
backup show
backup delete

Implements: blueprint volume-v2
Change-Id: I68bd303c194f304ad15f899d335b72a8bf3ebe10

commit_message:
Sync oslo-incubator cc19617

Sync oslo-inclubator files to commit
cc19617bf7dc633a9395e8db33835840d70298e2 .

Changes since last commit:

 $ git log --oneline --no-merges f2cfbba..cc19617 -- \
 openstack/common/eventlet_backdoor.py
 openstack/common/fileutils.py
 openstack/common/loopingcall.py
 openstack/common/service.py
 openstack/common/threadgroup.py

16eb642 Clean up logging to conform to guidelines
97ba6db Port service to Python 3
702bc56 service child process normal SIGTERM exit
64b5819 Revert "Revert "Revert "Optimization of waiting subprocesses in ProcessLauncher"""
f5646ed Revert "Revert "Optimization of waiting subprocesses in ProcessLauncher""
d24b658 Revert "Optimization of waiting subprocesses in ProcessLauncher"
593005b ProcessLauncher: reload config file in parent process on SIGHUP
f29e865 Store ProcessLauncher signal handlers on class level

Change-Id: Ie31ef57e847f11b9e322aa8c05f95b62b0dae61e

commit_message:
VMware: insecure option should be exposed

Commit Ida730db66b154a4d445f7a91bccb9ca5b5a26f5e introduced
certificate verification but did not expose the option to turn
on/off verification using the insecure boolean of oslo.vmware.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I834c9fb407c8790dab14db0308f7e7f1d551669e
Closes-Bug: #1451633

By default, the SP is disabled. It should be enabled in order to

commit_message:
Add "enabled" to create service provider example

By default, the SP is disabled. It should be enabled in order to
retrieve a SAML assertion targeted to it.

Change-Id: I445b59e4e7c68282051aa13e8c4d47485a725d0f

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-11 05:39:48.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/access_and_security/security_groups/tables.py'], 'message': 'Display ID column in the Security Group table

commit_message:
Display ID column in the Security Group table

This patch set is to add ID column in the security group table.
This is useful when there are multiple security group that has the
same name.

Change-Id: I5d4665a5d1fe6bd0c163721275c8e3c446788eae

1. The docstring in the SQLAlchemy tell us the usage,

   session.query(MyClass).\\

commit_message:
Refactor: Join multiple criteria together

Filtering criterion in the method of "Query.filter_by()" or
"Query.filter()" introduced by SQLAlchemy supports to join
multiple criteria together instead of join each criteria
separately.

The motivation to make this change includes,
1. The docstring in the SQLAlchemy tell us the usage,
" Multiple criteria are joined together by AND::

   session.query(MyClass).\\
      filter(MyClass.name == 'some name', MyClass.id > 5)"

or
" Multiple criteria are joined together by AND::

   session.query(MyClass).\\
      filter_by(name = 'some name', id = 5)
"

Since SQLAlchemy provides this interface, this should has
its benefit from introducing this method, the direct impact
is we needn't build the query statement repetitively.

2. The change make the code looks more concise.

Closes-Bug: #1449850
Change-Id: Iddf6b23a538c0bd05e69c9a170240058e1ed1b98

commit_message:
Improve test_set_members_deleting_less_than_5

In test_set_members_deleting_less_than_5[1], 3 ips are deleted from
ipset but test_set_members_deleting_less_than_5 checked that the
first one was deleted because the call ordering was non-trivial.

The test was successful because
assert_has_calls(expected_calls, any_order=False) allows extra calls
before and after expected_calls.

A parent change[2] forces the call ordering, this allows to check that
the 3 ips are deleted.

[1] neutron.tests.unit.agent.linux.test_ipset_manager
[2] I8408365825ec1e97a83c2181f38ec1f9468df91e

Related-Bug: #1348818

Change-Id: I773e2cd19fdec634b728d0c3a78c1d66392c743f

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-30 11:42:29.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/metering/test_metering_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_securitygroups_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/hacking/checks.py'], 'message': 'Remove use of contextlib.nested (db-tests)

Removed use of contextlib.nested call from codebase, as it has been
deprecated since Python 2.7.

There are also known issues with contextlib.nested that were addressed
by the native support for multiple "with" variables. For instance, if
the first object is created but the second one throws an exception,
the first object's __exit__ is never called. For more information see
https://docs.python.org/2/library/contextlib.html#contextlib.nested
contextlib.nested is also not compatible with Python 3.

Multi-patch set for easier chunks. This one addresses the tests from
neutron/tests/unit/db directory.

Line continuation markers (e.g. '\') had to be used or syntax
errors were thrown. While using parentheses is the preferred way
for multiple line statements, but in case of long with statements
backslashes are acceptable.

Partial-Bug: 1428424
Change-Id: I8eee732427188cc0c5e8dde25d1d6e10cf21cc12
'}]
commit_message:
Remove use of contextlib.nested (db-tests)

Removed use of contextlib.nested call from codebase, as it has been
deprecated since Python 2.7.

There are also known issues with contextlib.nested that were addressed
by the native support for multiple "with" variables. For instance, if
the first object is created but the second one throws an exception,
the first object's __exit__ is never called. For more information see
https://docs.python.org/2/library/contextlib.html#contextlib.nested
contextlib.nested is also not compatible with Python 3.

Multi-patch set for easier chunks. This one addresses the tests from
neutron/tests/unit/db directory.

Line continuation markers (e.g. '\') had to be used or syntax
errors were thrown. While using parentheses is the preferred way
for multiple line statements, but in case of long with statements
backslashes are acceptable.

Partial-Bug: 1428424
Change-Id: I8eee732427188cc0c5e8dde25d1d6e10cf21cc12

commit_message:
Fix branch for keystone bandit job

While the bandit job should only run on master for now, once the
next release is done it should work on the new stable branch, so
the job should only be skipped for the current stable branches.

Change-Id: I3b75d7aa520038a7ebe8f118b6a395cf50ccfeec

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-22 18:29:30.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'test-requirements-py3.txt'], 'message': 'Remove discover dependency

discover is not needed to run tests: oslotest is based on
testtools.run which uses unittest to discover tests. On Python 2.6,
unittest2 backport is used to get the discover feature.

Change-Id: Ice0f82251b77ab826a436cf7e5aed2573412e933

commit_message:
Remove discover dependency

discover is not needed to run tests: oslotest is based on
testtools.run which uses unittest to discover tests. On Python 2.6,
unittest2 backport is used to get the discover feature.

Change-Id: Ice0f82251b77ab826a436cf7e5aed2573412e933

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-22 19:36:31.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/common/utils.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/common/test_utils.py', 'neutron/api/rpc/handlers/l3_rpc.py'], 'message': "Defer creation of router JSON in get_routers RPC

The get_routers method in the l3 RPC code has a log.debug
statement that formats all of the router data as indented
JSON. This method can be expensive if there are hundreds
of routers being synced and it happens even if debugging
is disabled since the function call result is the parameter
to the debug statement.

This patch adds and leverages a small helper class that takes a
callable and its args and defers calling it until the __str__ method
is called on it when it's actually trying to be rendered to a string.

Change-Id: I2bfceb286ce30f2a3595381b62bdc6dd71ed8483
Partial-Bug: #1445412
(cherry picked from commit 649599457e29b58ad0aec9ace990e0a2b59b05d0)
"}]
commit_message:
Defer creation of router JSON in get_routers RPC

The get_routers method in the l3 RPC code has a log.debug
statement that formats all of the router data as indented
JSON. This method can be expensive if there are hundreds
of routers being synced and it happens even if debugging
is disabled since the function call result is the parameter
to the debug statement.

This patch adds and leverages a small helper class that takes a
callable and its args and defers calling it until the __str__ method
is called on it when it's actually trying to be rendered to a string.

Change-Id: I2bfceb286ce30f2a3595381b62bdc6dd71ed8483
Partial-Bug: #1445412
(cherry picked from commit 649599457e29b58ad0aec9ace990e0a2b59b05d0)

commit_message:
Get completely rid of contextlib.nested

`contextlib.nested` is deprecated since Python 2.7 and incompatible with
Python 3. This patch removes all its occurences by using the helper
script at [1].

This is a necessary step to allow us running all unit tests with
Python 3 (not just a small subset as it is done now).

[1]: https://github.com/adrienverge/context_unnester

Change-Id: I8d1de09ff38ed0af9fb56f423a2c43476408e0fb
Blueprint: neutron-python3
Closes-Bug: #1428424

subject: Workaround db2 dialect bug in migrate 73
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-09 16:58:25.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/sql/migrate_repo/versions/073_insert_assignment_inherited_pk.py'], 'message': 'Workaround db2 dialect bug in migrate 73

When running migration 73, the DB2 dialect tries to create an
index on just the `inherited` column unlike the mysql dialect
which just updates the metadata.

A workaround is provided until the DB2 dialect bug can be fixed.

The bug reported against the DB2 dialect is
https://code.google.com/p/ibm-db/issues/detail?id=173

Related-Bug: 1453419
Change-Id: Ia9a28c31ad9a6970c6ad8d243393ab4b4fe07880
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround db2 dialect bug in migrate 73

When running migration 73, the DB2 dialect tries to create an
index on just the `inherited` column unlike the mysql dialect
which just updates the metadata.

A workaround is provided until the DB2 dialect bug can be fixed.

The bug reported against the DB2 dialect is
https://code.google.com/p/ibm-db/issues/detail?id=173

Related-Bug: 1453419
Change-Id: Ia9a28c31ad9a6970c6ad8d243393ab4b4fe07880

commit_message:
Fix indentation errors in tests

They are some missing/extra indentations in tests source code. This
results in variables used out their scope (which remains unnoticed as
long as `with` contexts do not fail), and prevent refactoring scripts
(such as the one for getting rid of `contextlib.nested` [1]) from
performing well.

This simple patch fixes these indentation errors.

[1]: See change I8d1de09ff38ed0af9fb56f423a2c43476408e0fb

Change-Id: Icef34c7755e0d96c4c5ee85982de86d0ccc196c7
Related-Blueprint: neutron-python3

a file on disk and reused a pristine version of it to save setup time.
We can delete this code since we no longer do this.

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-05-29 09:55:40.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Create instance_extra entry if it doesn't update

When updating an instance, if there is no instance_extra, for older
instances, we make sure we create one if there is not one already.

This keeps flavor data migrations (ie system_metadata ->
instance_extra) from failing when the system_metadata entries are soft
deleted but an instance_extra entry is not created because it was
"updated" assuming an instance_extra entry already existed, leaving
the instance with no flavor data.

Closes-Bug: #1459758
Change-Id: I715217d98729c6c5ac45d64d8bacaaca745ff3d7
'}]
commit_message:
Create instance_extra entry if it doesn't update

When updating an instance, if there is no instance_extra, for older
instances, we make sure we create one if there is not one already.

This keeps flavor data migrations (ie system_metadata ->
instance_extra) from failing when the system_metadata entries are soft
deleted but an instance_extra entry is not created because it was
"updated" assuming an instance_extra entry already existed, leaving
the instance with no flavor data.

Closes-Bug: #1459758
Change-Id: I715217d98729c6c5ac45d64d8bacaaca745ff3d7

subject: Elaborate on warning message
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 612, 'name': 'Tom Fifield', 'email': 'tom@openstack.org', 'username': 'fifieldt'}, {'_account_id': 2556, 'name': 'Evan Callicoat', 'email': 'apsu@propter.net', 'username': 'diopter'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 7776, 'name': 'Paul Carver', 'email': 'pcarver@att.com', 'username': 'pcarver'}, {'_account_id': 9162, 'name': 'Lana Brindley', 'email': 'openstack@lanabrindley.com', 'username': 'loquacity'}, {'_account_id': 9515, 'name': 'Matthew Kassawara', 'email': 'mkassawara@gmail.com', 'username': 'ionosphere80'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-05-29 13:03:22.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_basics-networking-neutron.xml', 'doc/install-guide/section_basics-networking-nova.xml'], 'message': 'Elaborate on warning message

The warning about removing 127.0.1.1 is potentially confusing
(at least it confused me) because 127.0.0.1 is well known
as the loopback address and it may not be apparent that the
warning is actually about a different IP, 127.0.1.1 which
is not as well known. This patch elaborates on the fact
that 127.0.1.1, not 127.0.0.1 must be removed from
/etc/hosts.

Change-Id: Ie358dde24fc07c98948075d97c981985f5c2694b
Closes-Bug: 1459825
'}]
commit_message:
Elaborate on warning message

The warning about removing 127.0.1.1 is potentially confusing
(at least it confused me) because 127.0.0.1 is well known
as the loopback address and it may not be apparent that the
warning is actually about a different IP, 127.0.1.1 which
is not as well known. This patch elaborates on the fact
that 127.0.1.1, not 127.0.0.1 must be removed from
/etc/hosts.

Change-Id: Ie358dde24fc07c98948075d97c981985f5c2694b
Closes-Bug: 1459825

subject: Add launchpad tag used by "Report a bug"
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-05-29 17:10:42.000000000', 'files': ['doc/admin-guide-cloud-rst/source/conf.py'], 'message': 'Add launchpad tag used by "Report a bug"

"Report a bug" automatically populates bugs on launchpad with
information about the manual. This additional config setting
will allow "Report a bug" to automatically tag the bug with the
respective manual.

Add this for admin-cloud-rst like it was done for the other guides.

Also, decrease version number to 0.9, it's not a 1.0 release yet.

Change-Id: I4555cc28ef30527e4349da5c4928ba265a19bb23
'}]
commit_message:
Add launchpad tag used by "Report a bug"

"Report a bug" automatically populates bugs on launchpad with
information about the manual. This additional config setting
will allow "Report a bug" to automatically tag the bug with the
respective manual.

Add this for admin-cloud-rst like it was done for the other guides.

Also, decrease version number to 0.9, it's not a 1.0 release yet.

Change-Id: I4555cc28ef30527e4349da5c4928ba265a19bb23

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-05-12 17:54:30.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_dellfc.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_dellscapi.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell/dell_storagecenter_common.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell/dell_storagecenter_api.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_dellsc.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell/dell_storagecenter_fc.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell/dell_storagecenter_iscsi.py'], 'message': 'Dell SC driver honoring folder name after volume creation.

The Dell SC driver was not honoring the volume folder name
after creation.  This has been changed so that find_volume
now checks the dell_sc_volume_folder for the requested volume
before doing a general search of the storage center.  In
either case if more than one volume is returned (two in
the dell_sc_volume_folder or two outside of that folder) then
an exception is thrown.

Also the dell_sc_volume_folder, dell_sc_server_folder and
dell_sc_ssn variables are no longer being passed arond.  They
are saved as part of the backend API object.

Tests have been updated.

Change-Id: I962ea3ed262d21deff65cdc8476939aab6ba07e2
Closes-Bug: #1449290
'}]
commit_message:
Dell SC driver honoring folder name after volume creation.

The Dell SC driver was not honoring the volume folder name
after creation.  This has been changed so that find_volume
now checks the dell_sc_volume_folder for the requested volume
before doing a general search of the storage center.  In
either case if more than one volume is returned (two in
the dell_sc_volume_folder or two outside of that folder) then
an exception is thrown.

Also the dell_sc_volume_folder, dell_sc_server_folder and
dell_sc_ssn variables are no longer being passed arond.  They
are saved as part of the backend API object.

Tests have been updated.

Change-Id: I962ea3ed262d21deff65cdc8476939aab6ba07e2
Closes-Bug: #1449290

commit_message:
Fix Flavor Detail tbl in legacy Launch Instance

This patch fixes the misaligned rows of the Flavour Details table, on
the first tab of the legacy Launch Instance workflow.

Patch also changes the markup for the Networks tab, which relied on CSS
that this patch removes.

Change-Id: Ie2fcedb5a7a7f5b3d9ffffd4f245f7ec5ff5470d
Closes-Bug: 1443322

subject: Auto-delete queues were deleted on RabbitMQ failover
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-26 08:12:04.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': "Auto-delete queues were deleted on RabbitMQ failover

When RPC client starts listening to reply queue and got disconnected from RabbitMQ,
reply queue got deleted because it was marked as auto-delete and no more consumers
were present.

This fix replaces auto-delete with queue 1H expiration. So clients have
up to an hour to reconnect to RaqbbitMQ prior to server's reply gets lost

Adopted from Ic1a20c309ff90618f715f4034847e6e159c486e8
Co-Authored-By: Stan Lagun<slagun@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I9119ee7fa798918811044625271140fabd812651
Closes-Bug: #1349301
"}]
commit_message:
Auto-delete queues were deleted on RabbitMQ failover

When RPC client starts listening to reply queue and got disconnected from RabbitMQ,
reply queue got deleted because it was marked as auto-delete and no more consumers
were present.

This fix replaces auto-delete with queue 1H expiration. So clients have
up to an hour to reconnect to RaqbbitMQ prior to server's reply gets lost

Adopted from Ic1a20c309ff90618f715f4034847e6e159c486e8
Co-Authored-By: Stan Lagun<slagun@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I9119ee7fa798918811044625271140fabd812651
Closes-Bug: #1349301

commit_message:
Fix the wrong check when boot from volume

Now,when create a server booting from volume.It will
raise an unexpcted 'FlavorDiskTooSmall' error in some
case.

For example,use 1G flavor and a 2G bootable volume of
which the image is small than 1G.The error would be
occured.

Change-Id: If4d04340a82ec98de6f44c485dd8d683284d0f06
Closes-bug: #1457517

subject: Ensure empty paths raise a value error
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-12 05:33:30.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/persistence/backends/impl_memory.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/persistence/test_memory_persistence.py'], 'message': 'Ensure empty paths raise a value error

Empty paths should not be allowed to be set or
fetched or normalized so check for those and raise
an error when one is encountered.

Also add some basic test conditions that ensure
the normpath method raises when it should.

Change-Id: I7f7e6600f03c67376ba310ab231b2e33cd7528db
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure empty paths raise a value error

Empty paths should not be allowed to be set or
fetched or normalized so check for those and raise
an error when one is encountered.

Also add some basic test conditions that ensure
the normpath method raises when it should.

Change-Id: I7f7e6600f03c67376ba310ab231b2e33cd7528db

subject: Start adding rejection policy prototype to executors (WIP)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-27 02:06:22.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/types/futures.py', 'requirements-py2.txt', 'requirements-py3.txt'], 'message': 'Start adding rejection policy prototype to executors (WIP)

It is often desirable to have an executor do something
else then queue up work when its workers are at capacity.

To start to support this we need to start defining and
adding support to the existing executors so that they accept
and respect a provided policy.

Experiment for http://bugs.python.org/issue22737

Change-Id: Ieac2f8c002a96f98cf93fbd3e92afbd4b13702e1
'}]
commit_message:
Start adding rejection policy prototype to executors (WIP)

It is often desirable to have an executor do something
else then queue up work when its workers are at capacity.

To start to support this we need to start defining and
adding support to the existing executors so that they accept
and respect a provided policy.

Experiment for http://bugs.python.org/issue22737

Change-Id: Ieac2f8c002a96f98cf93fbd3e92afbd4b13702e1

commit_message:
Use states.check_task/retry_transition in action(s)

Be more strict about our task and retry transition(s) and
call into the state transition checking function(s) to ensure
that we continue making valid transition(s) or die.

Change-Id: Ib016e787a9382d06d4a7c15298bbcaa9a3f80368

commit_message:
Switch from MySQL-python to PyMySQL

As discussed in the Liberty Design Summit "Moving apps to Python 3"
cross-project workshop, the way forward in the near future is to
switch to the pure-python PyMySQL library as a default.

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/liberty-cross-project-python3

commit_message:
Document how to use network isolation/static IPs

This patch adds a file documenting the use of isolated networks with static
IP addresses. This optional functionality allows the use of static IP addresses
on networks based on function: Internal API, tenant, storage, storage management,
and external/public API.

Change-Id: I185c6d87cb4e84d7c58ac279b8e6609d876c82c9
Co-Authored-By: dprince@redhat.com

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2015-05-27 13:40:20.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/targets/test_lio_driver.py', 'cinder/volume/targets/cxt.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/targets/targets_fixture.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/targets/test_cxt_driver.py', 'cinder/cmd/rtstool.py', 'cinder/volume/targets/lio.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/targets/test_iet_driver.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/targets/test_tgt_driver.py', 'cinder/volume/targets/iscsi.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_cmd.py'], 'message': 'Create iSCSI lio portals with right IPs and port

Currently lioadm helper creates portals with fixed IP addresses 0.0.0.0
and ::0 and also uses fixed standard port 3260 instead of using store
configuration (iscsi_ip_address, iscsi_secondary_ip_addresses,
iscsi_port) from the configuration as it should.

This could lead to problems if a different port was defined in the
configuration as the target would be available only on 3260 and other
services would look for it at configured port.

With this fix we now create the right portals with the right port.

Since now we pass list of ips and port to helpers cxt helper has also
been updated to use these parameters instead of going directly to the
configuration.

Change-Id: I77e8865b1f015a9fa155f2b4552a5d9c27f5e122
Closes-Bug: #1425875
'}]
commit_message:
Create iSCSI lio portals with right IPs and port

Currently lioadm helper creates portals with fixed IP addresses 0.0.0.0
and ::0 and also uses fixed standard port 3260 instead of using store
configuration (iscsi_ip_address, iscsi_secondary_ip_addresses,
iscsi_port) from the configuration as it should.

This could lead to problems if a different port was defined in the
configuration as the target would be available only on 3260 and other
services would look for it at configured port.

With this fix we now create the right portals with the right port.

Since now we pass list of ips and port to helpers cxt helper has also
been updated to use these parameters instead of going directly to the
configuration.

Change-Id: I77e8865b1f015a9fa155f2b4552a5d9c27f5e122
Closes-Bug: #1425875

The voting configuration for governance produces a red-x and
green-check for +/-1 code reviews now, which is confusing to people
since they normally associate those icons with +/-2 votes.  This
change expands the vote range to include +/-2 but gives no one
permission to vote at those levels.  This should cause Code-Review
votes to appear as +/-1, while the NoOp function continues to
mean that +2 votes are not necessary.

Change-Id: I31adfe3c847d181809825e1030e8c165e67ae9aa
'}]
commit_message:
Expand the vote range for governance

The voting configuration for governance produces a red-x and
green-check for +/-1 code reviews now, which is confusing to people
since they normally associate those icons with +/-2 votes.  This
change expands the vote range to include +/-2 but gives no one
permission to vote at those levels.  This should cause Code-Review
votes to appear as +/-1, while the NoOp function continues to
mean that +2 votes are not necessary.

Change-Id: I31adfe3c847d181809825e1030e8c165e67ae9aa

subject: Simplify the check for whether a metric matches
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-29 21:46:58.000000000', 'files': ['thresh/src/main/java/monasca/thresh/domain/model/MetricDefinitionAndTenantIdMatcher.java', 'thresh/src/test/java/monasca/thresh/domain/model/MetricDefinitionAndTenantIdMatcherTest.java'], 'message': "Simplify the check for whether a metric matches

The old way was more efficient if there were few dimensions on
the metric and lots of Alarm Definitions with different
dimension sets for a given tenant id and metric name, but that
is probably unlikely. The more common case will be one or two
alarm definitions per tenant id and metric name and more
dimensions on the metric. The new algorithm is faster for that
case since it doesn't create every possible combinations of
dimensions like the old algorithm

Change-Id: I183570d52c61f0a2932cf37c5c659a6c529b4bbb
"}]
commit_message:
Simplify the check for whether a metric matches

The old way was more efficient if there were few dimensions on
the metric and lots of Alarm Definitions with different
dimension sets for a given tenant id and metric name, but that
is probably unlikely. The more common case will be one or two
alarm definitions per tenant id and metric name and more
dimensions on the metric. The new algorithm is faster for that
case since it doesn't create every possible combinations of
dimensions like the old algorithm

Change-Id: I183570d52c61f0a2932cf37c5c659a6c529b4bbb

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-05-28 21:14:50.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/hyperv/pathutils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_hypervapi.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_pathutils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_migrationops.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/migrationops.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/fake.py'], 'message': "Hyper-V: Fixes cold migration / resize issue

Commit 3e42c7ae3f7a9353834c8c9c4dc79ee39dd0783b changed where the Hyper-V
VM configuration files are stored. The files are being stored in the same
folder as the instance. Performing a cold resize / migration will cause a
os.rename call on the instance's folder, which fails as long as there are
configuration files used by Hyper-V in that folder, thus resulting in a
failed migration and the instance ending up in ERROR state.

Hyper-V configuration files are stored in a subfolder of the instance's
folder (e.g.: C:\OpenStack\Instances\instance-000000b6\Virtual Machines).

This commit makes sure that Hyper-V configuration files are not being
moved during migration by skipping subfolders in the instance's folder.

Change-Id: I4874eed7d284fab241e4371e550a88270ca156f1
Closes-Bug: #1453835
"}]
commit_message:
Hyper-V: Fixes cold migration / resize issue

Commit 3e42c7ae3f7a9353834c8c9c4dc79ee39dd0783b changed where the Hyper-V
VM configuration files are stored. The files are being stored in the same
folder as the instance. Performing a cold resize / migration will cause a
os.rename call on the instance's folder, which fails as long as there are
configuration files used by Hyper-V in that folder, thus resulting in a
failed migration and the instance ending up in ERROR state.

Hyper-V configuration files are stored in a subfolder of the instance's
folder (e.g.: C:\OpenStack\Instances\instance-000000b6\Virtual Machines).

This commit makes sure that Hyper-V configuration files are not being
moved during migration by skipping subfolders in the instance's folder.

Change-Id: I4874eed7d284fab241e4371e550a88270ca156f1
Closes-Bug: #1453835

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-05-29 15:44:33.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_ipset_manager.py'], 'message': 'Sort _get_new/deleted_set_ips responses in unittests

This fixes the test_set_members_adding/deleting_less_than_5 unit test
that breaks with a randomized PYTHONHASHSEED (see the bug report).

The test assumed that the _get_new/deleted_set_ips from
neutron.agent.linux.ipset_manager return elements in a particular order.
Found with PYTHONHASHSEED=1.

The fix refactors the test case to force sorted responses from
_get_new/deleted_set_ips during unittests.

Partial-bug: #1348818

Note: There are several other unrelated unit tests that also break with
a randomized PYTHONHASHSEED, but they are not addressed here. They will
be addressed in separate patches.

Change-Id: I8408365825ec1e97a83c2181f38ec1f9468df91e
'}]
commit_message:
Sort _get_new/deleted_set_ips responses in unittests

This fixes the test_set_members_adding/deleting_less_than_5 unit test
that breaks with a randomized PYTHONHASHSEED (see the bug report).

The test assumed that the _get_new/deleted_set_ips from
neutron.agent.linux.ipset_manager return elements in a particular order.
Found with PYTHONHASHSEED=1.

The fix refactors the test case to force sorted responses from
_get_new/deleted_set_ips during unittests.

Partial-bug: #1348818

Note: There are several other unrelated unit tests that also break with
a randomized PYTHONHASHSEED, but they are not addressed here. They will
be addressed in separate patches.

Change-Id: I8408365825ec1e97a83c2181f38ec1f9468df91e

commit_message:
Allow to remove second _send_reply() call

Added a new configuration option `send_single_reply` which allows to
send a single AMQP reply instead of two. This will reduce amount of RPC
calls and increase transport productivity.

The new behaviour is not compatible with the old logic, so isn't
backward compatible and disabled by default.

DocImpact
A new configuration option added.

Blueprint: remove-double-reply

Change-Id: Idab118b22163e734aca010f325cddfaec26bfa0f

Since Keystone has the ability to be deployed with an LDAP backend, we can't
guarantee that project IDs will always be UUID formatted. That change makes it
so that we attempt to convert project IDs to bytes before packing and if we

commit_message:
Don't assume project IDs are UUID format

Since Keystone has the ability to be deployed with an LDAP backend, we can't
guarantee that project IDs will always be UUID formatted. That change makes it
so that we attempt to convert project IDs to bytes before packing and if we
fail, pass the original project ID into the payload at the expense of a
slightly longer payload.

Change-Id: Id81ed23879ee7a9adeb50454ef0cb7acd13f1a0a
Related-Bug: 1459382

commit_message:
Don't assume group IDs are UUID format

When using the Fernet token provider to build a federated payload, we can't
assume that the group ID will always be a UUID format that we can convert to
bytes. This change makes the Fernet code smart enough to pass the original
group ID in the payload if it can't convert it to bytes.

Change-Id: I6d00902eb461c22aafd9cb5ca706b05bedefd37d
Related-Bug: 1459382

While we don't use ipset in namespaces in production code, we do
during functional testing. This patch adds a sanity check while will
be used to determine if the ipset tests should be run in a future

commit_message:
Add sanity test for ipset in a namespace

Old ipset/kernel versions cannot properly use ipset in namespaces.
While we don't use ipset in namespaces in production code, we do
during functional testing. This patch adds a sanity check while will
be used to determine if the ipset tests should be run in a future
patch.

The sanity check was run on both a new and old kernel/ipset.
The check properly succeeds or fails and cleans up all resources
in both cases.

Related-Bug: #1459855
Change-Id: I3f3d108df14f1583f558643c555a17ed3fd6ca5a

subject: Expand the vote range for infra-specs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-29 22:25:30.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/acls/openstack-infra/infra-specs.config'], 'message': 'Expand the vote range for infra-specs

The voting configuration for infra-specs produces a red-x and
green-check for +/-1 code reviews now, which is confusing to people
since they normally associate those icons with +/-2 votes.  This
change expands the vote range to include +/-2 but gives no one
permission to vote at those levels.  This should cause Code-Review
votes to appear as +/-1, while the NoOp function continues to
mean that +2 votes are not necessary.

Also extend the Council-Vote to +2, but similarly give no permissions
to use it so that council votes will appear as +1, -1, or red-x in
the case of a -2 veto (the -1/green-check dichotomy would also
seem weird for similar reasons).

Change-Id: I042e6168334fb11291edbaed97b3ae2424218166
'}]
commit_message:
Expand the vote range for infra-specs

The voting configuration for infra-specs produces a red-x and
green-check for +/-1 code reviews now, which is confusing to people
since they normally associate those icons with +/-2 votes.  This
change expands the vote range to include +/-2 but gives no one
permission to vote at those levels.  This should cause Code-Review
votes to appear as +/-1, while the NoOp function continues to
mean that +2 votes are not necessary.

Also extend the Council-Vote to +2, but similarly give no permissions
to use it so that council votes will appear as +1, -1, or red-x in
the case of a -2 veto (the -1/green-check dichotomy would also
seem weird for similar reasons).

Change-Id: I042e6168334fb11291edbaed97b3ae2424218166

commit_message:
go: replace ghetto getpwnam with os/user

Parsing /etc/passwd was always goofy, but some stuff that came up when
googling "golang getpwnam" led me to believe this functionality just
didn't exist in the go standard library.

Then I ran across os/user a few days ago, which is exactly what's needed.

Change-Id: I937f0a1397c70dc3f7b5b77d939deb10d6c7c480

commit_message:
Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for service_get_by_host*

This patches remove the hard-code permission checks for db call
service_get_by_host_and_topic and service_get_all_by_host_and_binary.

There are elevated contexts in the code used to call those methods which
aren't removed in this patch. The elevated context will be cleaned up in
last step. This is safe if we forget removing some hard-code permission.

Partially implements bp nova-api-policy-final-part

Change-Id: I1c26a1285c027ee51621c7b3b04c95daa5b835ca

subject: Allow SAIO to answer is_local_device() better
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-05-27 20:19:05.000000000', 'files': ['test/probe/common.py', 'swift/container/sync.py', 'swift/obj/reconstructor.py', 'test/unit/common/test_db_replicator.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_replicator.py', 'test/probe/test_object_handoff.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_reconstructor.py', 'swift/obj/replicator.py', 'test/probe/test_container_failures.py', 'swift/common/utils.py', 'test/probe/test_empty_device_handoff.py', 'test/unit/container/test_sync.py', 'swift/common/db_replicator.py', 'swift/account/reaper.py', 'test/probe/test_account_failures.py', 'test/probe/test_object_async_update.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Allow SAIO to answer is_local_device() better

Common SAIO setups have multiple "servers" all on the same host with
different ports for the different "servers" (which happen to match the
IPs specified in the rings for the devices on each of those "servers").

This breaks down if you want to set up the SAIO to have one
object-server per disk.

However, you can configure the SAIO to have different localhost IP
addresses (e.g. 127.0.0.1, 127.0.0.2, etc.) in the ring and in the
servers' config files' bind_ip setting.

This new whataremyips() implementation combined with a little plumbing
allows is_local_device() to accurately answer, even on an SAIO.

In the default case (an unspecified bind_ip defaults to '0.0.0.0') as
well as an explict "bind to everything" like '0.0.0.0' or '::',
whataremyips() behaves as it always has, returning all IP addresses for
the server.

Also updated probe tests to handle each "server" in the SAIO having a
unique IP address.

Change-Id: I7dfef9cc4a3c48145011d9d13d904e6b623de020
'}]
commit_message:
Allow SAIO to answer is_local_device() better

Common SAIO setups have multiple "servers" all on the same host with
different ports for the different "servers" (which happen to match the
IPs specified in the rings for the devices on each of those "servers").

This breaks down if you want to set up the SAIO to have one
object-server per disk.

However, you can configure the SAIO to have different localhost IP
addresses (e.g. 127.0.0.1, 127.0.0.2, etc.) in the ring and in the
servers' config files' bind_ip setting.

This new whataremyips() implementation combined with a little plumbing
allows is_local_device() to accurately answer, even on an SAIO.

In the default case (an unspecified bind_ip defaults to '0.0.0.0') as
well as an explict "bind to everything" like '0.0.0.0' or '::',
whataremyips() behaves as it always has, returning all IP addresses for
the server.

Also updated probe tests to handle each "server" in the SAIO having a
unique IP address.

Change-Id: I7dfef9cc4a3c48145011d9d13d904e6b623de020

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-27 14:14:19.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/acls/openstack/governance.config'], 'message': 'Alter governance repo voting rules

Restrict Code-Review votes to -1..+1, but allow anyone to leave
them.  This will allow direct binary feedback from both TC and
non-TC members on a change (currently, feedback from non-TC members
requires leaving a comment).  Make Code-Review votes not required
for a change to merge.  This means they are purely advisory.

Add a TC-Vote label and allow TC members to vote -1..+1 on this
label.  This will allow the formal tallying of TC member votes.
It is also not required (by Gerrit) since the actual rules are
complicated and no one thinks implementing them in prolog is
a good idea.  So we will simply rely on the chair to tally the
votes properly and execute the workflow or abandon operations
as appropriate.

Change-Id: I510bf1195d8af5d5c466fb05630ad6f9ec11b3e1
'}]
commit_message:
Alter governance repo voting rules

Restrict Code-Review votes to -1..+1, but allow anyone to leave
them.  This will allow direct binary feedback from both TC and
non-TC members on a change (currently, feedback from non-TC members
requires leaving a comment).  Make Code-Review votes not required
for a change to merge.  This means they are purely advisory.

Add a TC-Vote label and allow TC members to vote -1..+1 on this
label.  This will allow the formal tallying of TC member votes.
It is also not required (by Gerrit) since the actual rules are
complicated and no one thinks implementing them in prolog is
a good idea.  So we will simply rely on the chair to tally the
votes properly and execute the workflow or abandon operations
as appropriate.

Change-Id: I510bf1195d8af5d5c466fb05630ad6f9ec11b3e1

commit_message:
Use oslo.log instead of oslo.incubator log module

oslo.log has graduated from oslo-incubator, magnum need use oslo.log
instead of oslo.incubator log module.

NOTE: openstack.common.log registers its options at import time, but
oslo.log needs to call register_options() explicitly.

Change-Id: I671bb020b628bd972813daf5936040b7f1c6bf7a
Closes-Bug: #1459736

commit_message:
Make ansible more verbose in gate-wrap

We have a case where ansible is taking over an hour to excute
what appears to be moving a file. This patch adds -vvv to the
ansible execution commands to see if we can get more information
about what is happening during that hour.

Job Reference:
https://jenkins01.openstack.org/job/check-tempest-dsvm-full/822/console

Change-Id: I22f2c3b97378996be21943ae9f01d14e07d38e83

commit_message:
Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for service_get_by_compute_host

This patches remove the hard-code permission checks for db call
service_get_by_compute_host.

There are elevated contexts in the code used to call those methods which
aren't removed in this patch. The elevated context will be cleaned up in
last step. This is safe if we forget removing some hard-code permission.

Partially implements bp nova-api-policy-final-part

Change-Id: I06c90564e32a89761b752782d3fb74da9cc4d343

As the docs point out(*), _exit should be used after a fork() to avoid

effects, etc.  This change does just that.

Change-Id: I68da6283c44ab8857baf217ac1443bd17988257d
'}]
commit_message:
Use os._exit after forking

As the docs point out(*), _exit should be used after a fork() to avoid
both processes flushing filehandles, calling destructors with side
effects, etc.  This change does just that.

(*) https://docs.python.org/2/library/os.html#os._exit

Change-Id: I68da6283c44ab8857baf217ac1443bd17988257d

commit_message:
Cleanup stale metadata processes on l3 agent sync

Currently l3 agent only cleans up stale namespaces.
The fix adds checking and deleting stale metadata processes
to NamespaceManager class responsible for clearing stale
namespaces

Change-Id: I2b081803e312589d3d8a7808d286a6c9827ef53f
Closes-Bug: #1455042

revisions:

This change adds parameters to specify which networks the MySQL
service will use. If the internal_api network exists the MySQL
service will bind to the IP address on that network, otherwise

network.

Change-Id: I4fba2c957f7db47e916bc269fb4bd32ccc99bd4c

commit_message:
Map Mysql to isolated networks

This change adds parameters to specify which networks the MySQL
service will use. If the internal_api network exists the MySQL
service will bind to the IP address on that network, otherwise
the services will default to the IP on the Undercloud 'ctlplane'
network.

This patch also drop the old 'controller_host' variable from
the puppet controller template since it is no longer in use.

Change-Id: I4fba2c957f7db47e916bc269fb4bd32ccc99bd4c

commit_message:
Use heat inputs for network port settings

This patch updates the controller and compute roles
so that we use get_input in the software configuration
instead of calling get_attr/get_param there.

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-05-26 12:18:37.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Bump ddt to min version 0.7.0

Manila and manilaclient projects use lib "ddt" for testing. Both use feature
of this lib that appeared only starting with version 0.7.0 [1]
It worked till that moment because latest version was installed each time.
But it can cause errors in theory if current version 0.4.0 will be installed
indeed.

[1]: https://github.com/txels/ddt/commit/c55bbf5d

Change-Id: Iea6881a5efc7e3203747603727bec51bf4a4c0d8
'}]
commit_message:
Bump ddt to min version 0.7.0

Manila and manilaclient projects use lib "ddt" for testing. Both use feature
of this lib that appeared only starting with version 0.7.0 [1]
It worked till that moment because latest version was installed each time.
But it can cause errors in theory if current version 0.4.0 will be installed
indeed.

[1]: https://github.com/txels/ddt/commit/c55bbf5d

Change-Id: Iea6881a5efc7e3203747603727bec51bf4a4c0d8

commit_message:
Bump oslo.vmware version to 0.13.1

oslo.vmware 0.13 now uses suds-jurko, instead of suds, which is
compatible with Python 3.

oslo.vmware 0.13 caused issues in nova, issue fixed in oslo.vmware
0.13.1.

This change prepares the work to drop the suds dependency.

Change-Id: I2fc039f6540b4a272f4e1abf3ea4e5240295e4c2
