subject: Don't create a new channel in RabbitMQ Connection.reset()
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-05-28 12:39:03.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/tests/drivers/test_impl_rabbit.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': "Don't create a new channel in RabbitMQ Connection.reset()

Current implementation of RabbitMQ driver in in Connection.reset() change
the channel to use and create a new channel for it. This happens after the
each message send.

There no big need to create a new channel each time, so we can cancel all
consumer queues, instead of creating a channel in reset().

Test test_connection_reset_always_succeed() removed, because we are not
create channel on reset() anymore.

Co-Authored-By: Mehdi Abaakouk <sileht@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie164840e6c055b01525b13aabdb8b9c7f5d1b98b
"}]
commit_message:
Don't create a new channel in RabbitMQ Connection.reset()

Current implementation of RabbitMQ driver in in Connection.reset() change
the channel to use and create a new channel for it. This happens after the
each message send.

There no big need to create a new channel each time, so we can cancel all
consumer queues, instead of creating a channel in reset().

Test test_connection_reset_always_succeed() removed, because we are not
create channel on reset() anymore.

Co-Authored-By: Mehdi Abaakouk <sileht@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie164840e6c055b01525b13aabdb8b9c7f5d1b98b

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-04-29 17:23:28.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/utils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_scheduler_utils.py'], 'message': 'Scheduler: Introduce a FilterRequestSpec class

As part of Scheduler refactoring, we are planning to move all the data
request_specs dict to NovaObjects. This effort is about solidifying the
external interfaces of the scheduler component, in hopes of moving it
out of the Nova project.

This patch can be seen as a small step in that direction, for the
purpose of using a more object like interface in the scheduler code
(mostly filters at this point).

As a basic example: We have a need to detect if the request sent to the
scheduler related to an instance attempts to change the flavor. We add
this functionality as a method on an object that wraps the request_spec
dictionary, that we can now use in filter code to make decisions.

With this we get to iterate over the objects API while punting the work
of actually changing the RPC API to use new objects to a later series,
while avoiding the need to add messy functionality as utility methods that
deal with request_spec dictionaries that are on their way out.

Change-Id: I4bdcfc1df9d0ed9b64c41213cd4e0613a1ab6c88
Partial-bug: #1370390
'}]
commit_message:
Scheduler: Introduce a FilterRequestSpec class

As part of Scheduler refactoring, we are planning to move all the data
request_specs dict to NovaObjects. This effort is about solidifying the
external interfaces of the scheduler component, in hopes of moving it
out of the Nova project.

This patch can be seen as a small step in that direction, for the
purpose of using a more object like interface in the scheduler code
(mostly filters at this point).

As a basic example: We have a need to detect if the request sent to the
scheduler related to an instance attempts to change the flavor. We add
this functionality as a method on an object that wraps the request_spec
dictionary, that we can now use in filter code to make decisions.

With this we get to iterate over the objects API while punting the work
of actually changing the RPC API to use new objects to a later series,
while avoiding the need to add messy functionality as utility methods that
deal with request_spec dictionaries that are on their way out.

Change-Id: I4bdcfc1df9d0ed9b64c41213cd4e0613a1ab6c88
Partial-bug: #1370390

subject: Add an import whitelist helper factory
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-04-29 11:12:53.000000000', 'files': ['hacking/tests/test_imports.py', 'hacking/checks/imports.py'], 'message': 'Add an import whitelist helper factory

This patch adds a factory function for creating checks that allow
whitelisting imports in certain files.

The returned function can be registered as a pep8 check, and expects to
be passed the code to be used for the rule, a file to consider, and
whitelists of stdlib, 3rd party and project modules.

Unit tests that are part of this patch give an example of how this can
be used to create a function for fictional rules Z123 and Z223, that we
can
register using pep8.register_check or as an entry point for flake8.

Change-Id: I61979d555fb2d551cdc0a02d41af8fd3e03247af
'}]
commit_message:
Add an import whitelist helper factory

This patch adds a factory function for creating checks that allow
whitelisting imports in certain files.

The returned function can be registered as a pep8 check, and expects to
be passed the code to be used for the rule, a file to consider, and
whitelists of stdlib, 3rd party and project modules.

Unit tests that are part of this patch give an example of how this can
be used to create a function for fictional rules Z123 and Z223, that we
can
register using pep8.register_check or as an entry point for flake8.

Change-Id: I61979d555fb2d551cdc0a02d41af8fd3e03247af

commit_message:
Match order of iptables arguments to iptables-save

The way we were forming our iptables rules was not matching
the output of iptables-save. This caused the logic that preserves
counters to miss many of the rules.

This patch corrects the order for the comments and the allowed address
pairs to match the output order of iptables-save.

Closes-Bug: #1456823
Change-Id: I34c2249d0865485578767865c82414e1d813d563
(cherry picked from commit 12889f70e1ae547598f4c663e9da5b9bb03e347e)

commit_message:
VMware: fill in instance metadata when resizing instances

Update instance metadata to the VMware resize spec. This is done by
updating the 'annotation' field. This enables an administrator
to search the VC according to values defined here.

Implemented blueprint vmware-driver-domain-metadata

Change-Id: I5794114e126a1bf0361e7035c40add8f7996468f

commit_message:
VMware: fill in instance metadata when launching instances

Add instance metadata to the VMware config spec. This is done by
updating the 'annotation' field. This enables an administrator
to search the VC according to values defined here.

Implemented blueprint vmware-driver-domain-metadata

Change-Id: Ia40fee366cab9ad99e276b0595fe0ad2972e54a9

I discovered with the functional tests that the delete proxy
was broken.  It should pass ignore_missing as a keyword argument
rather than positional.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-29 03:08:34.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_glusterfs.py', 'tools/pretty_tox.sh'], 'message': 'Remove the no-parallel setting from pretty_tox.sh

pretty_tox.sh was setting --no-parallel, so even if you
wanted to be dangerous and live on the edge you couldn't.

This patch removest that limiter and let's you either:
 a. Run as many processes as you have nproc
 b. Specify how many processes you want by using
    "tox -- --concurrency=<n>"

Note that much past 6, things get a bit unstable.  Your
mileage may vary.  Gate appears to use 8, ran a sequence
of 10 iterations locally succesfully after modifying the
gluster tests. May be other gotchas out there though.

Change-Id: I593b8086f19c37a5abc55a23f92253706e100daf
Closes-Bug: #1459852
Parital-Bug: #1459854
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the no-parallel setting from pretty_tox.sh

pretty_tox.sh was setting --no-parallel, so even if you
wanted to be dangerous and live on the edge you couldn't.

This patch removest that limiter and let's you either:
 a. Run as many processes as you have nproc
 b. Specify how many processes you want by using
    "tox -- --concurrency=<n>"

Note that much past 6, things get a bit unstable.  Your
mileage may vary.  Gate appears to use 8, ran a sequence
of 10 iterations locally succesfully after modifying the
gluster tests. May be other gotchas out there though.

Change-Id: I593b8086f19c37a5abc55a23f92253706e100daf
Closes-Bug: #1459852
Parital-Bug: #1459854

subject: Drop simplejson which was needed for Python 2.6
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-11 18:33:57.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_serialization/tests/test_jsonutils.py', 'oslo_serialization/jsonutils.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'tests/test_jsonutils.py'], 'message': "Drop simplejson which was needed for Python 2.6

In 2.6 and earlier, the JSON module wasn't loaded as a C module, so it
was helpful to use simplejson if it was available. Since Python 2.6
support has been dropped in Kilo, remove the logic around simplejson.

Change-Id: I32f06b730d575ccf4770007aedf5e6902284d939
"}]
commit_message:
Drop simplejson which was needed for Python 2.6

In 2.6 and earlier, the JSON module wasn't loaded as a C module, so it
was helpful to use simplejson if it was available. Since Python 2.6
support has been dropped in Kilo, remove the logic around simplejson.

Change-Id: I32f06b730d575ccf4770007aedf5e6902284d939

commit_message:
Remove appliance's hard-coded password in favor of ssh pub key

This removes the hard-coded password from the appliance VM's user-data
and replaces it with a SSH public key, which is read from a file whos
path is configured in rug.ini.

It also disables password logins for the user.  Another patch to
akanda-appliance-builder will allow developers to include a specified
debug user to allow debugging in dev environments.

Change-Id: I7db92bc7fd3743d89d73ab2a0b8da14685c30c69
(cherry picked from commit a06dbe7ab3d579c0c4cb84642ed1708d1442dc0b)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-29 18:07:38.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'tox.ini', 'tools/pretty_tox.sh'], 'message': 'Remove pretty_tox and use ostestr

This patch dumps pretty_tox.sh and gets Cinder on board
with using ostestr.  We're setting a concurrency value
of 6 (instances in the gate are 6 VCPU's), and things
seem to be stable at this value.

For folks running on 'smaller' system, it's still possible
to run in parallell > ncpu's but if there are problems you
can still specify concurrency in your tox argument.  Tox will
take the last occurence of the conncurrency argument; so for
example if you specify "tox -epy27 -- --concurrency=4" the
interpretted value for concurrency in the run will be 4.

Change-Id: I78c573367ffa1b2859c49e3ad6fcb4e586210f02
'}]
commit_message:
Remove pretty_tox and use ostestr

This patch dumps pretty_tox.sh and gets Cinder on board
with using ostestr.  We're setting a concurrency value
of 6 (instances in the gate are 6 VCPU's), and things
seem to be stable at this value.

For folks running on 'smaller' system, it's still possible
to run in parallell > ncpu's but if there are problems you
can still specify concurrency in your tox argument.  Tox will
take the last occurence of the conncurrency argument; so for
example if you specify "tox -epy27 -- --concurrency=4" the
interpretted value for concurrency in the run will be 4.

Change-Id: I78c573367ffa1b2859c49e3ad6fcb4e586210f02

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-05-05 20:50:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Reschedules sometimes do not allocate networks

Changes to instance.system_metadata weren't properly being saved
to the DB. The change to 'network_allocated' would be written to
the DB but not updated on the instance object. When the network
was cleaned up before a reschedule, the object would not notice
network_allocated' getting set to False, and not write the change
to the DB. After the reschedule, the instance would still have
'network_allocated' set to True, and skip allocating a network.
The node would go active with no network.

Since this is happening in the _allocate_network_async greenthread,
the solution is not to save in the async thread. The main thread
and the async thread share a reference to the same object and the
main thread waits for the async thread to finish before the final
save, so saving is unnecessary. I added comments on the
instance.save() calls that were part of the race so they don't get
removed or changed and reintroduce this bug.

Also, update the relevant test from mox to mock.

Change-Id: I937ec020b46703392bd603008d03af0f422bc0d1
"}]
commit_message:
Reschedules sometimes do not allocate networks

Changes to instance.system_metadata weren't properly being saved
to the DB. The change to 'network_allocated' would be written to
the DB but not updated on the instance object. When the network
was cleaned up before a reschedule, the object would not notice
network_allocated' getting set to False, and not write the change
to the DB. After the reschedule, the instance would still have
'network_allocated' set to True, and skip allocating a network.
The node would go active with no network.

Since this is happening in the _allocate_network_async greenthread,
the solution is not to save in the async thread. The main thread
and the async thread share a reference to the same object and the
main thread waits for the async thread to finish before the final
save, so saving is unnecessary. I added comments on the
instance.save() calls that were part of the race so they don't get
removed or changed and reintroduce this bug.

Also, update the relevant test from mox to mock.

Change-Id: I937ec020b46703392bd603008d03af0f422bc0d1

commit_message:
Revert "Merge "Bootstrap variable overrides should only be default values""

This reverts commit 1fefd0f4259d670cea4075a7a3e52caeaab7ea9b, reversing
changes made to 74e6da9f4314a96b6d714c966699435316b4c075.

This patch incorrectly layers defaults in SCSS, which doesn't work. A
default does not override another default, so adding !default to our
overrides has caused them not to work.

Change-Id: I9f9c98262a428d84efe7887f76ff9e1af451c29b
Closes-Bug: 1459573

commit_message:
Provide Fedora support for StrongSwan

The initial release of StrongSwan VPNaaS driver only support Ubuntu.
This patch will provide the Fedora support. The different usage of
StrongSwan between Fedora and Ubuntu are:
- Uses 'strongswan' CLI command instead of 'ipsec'
- Configuration files location is different
- Strongswan.d directory in template directory does not include
  'charon' directory

Change-Id: I27d8518d1d8110453d4674a0c6fb3cb6072a32f0
Closes-bug: 1444776
Closes-bug: 1441788
(cherry picked from commit f8a62b09b60d60ce3aa4d841ef97ec1d003281e2)

commit_message:
Handle proxies through environment variables

When running os-ansible-deployment on a cluster siting behind a proxy,
users may need to set up special variables for proxies so that pip, and
the services all work as expected.

Closes-bug: 1452456
Change-Id: I2a397abad6557a48bc737dcd9cca787fc5afa728

commit_message:
Perform sort when creating hostnames_ip file

Perform a sort when creating the openstack_hostnames_ips.yml file so
that this file is easier to read and is generated consistently between
runs of Ansible playbooks and commands.

Change-Id: I192fd8162c1da90c79f62524d5b92d96f11e9125
(cherry picked from commit bf4b897d768dc7fba990b3912d57e542c6866ad1)

Bandit is produced by the OpenStack security team to do

Change-Id: I14c34c2ec8db73179964282cc95df96bd9a600fa

commit_message:
Add tox target for bandit security checks

Bandit is produced by the OpenStack security team to do
static code analysis for security implementation failures.
It tests the code base for ~30 common security problems in
Python with more to come.

run with:
    tox -e bandit

Eventually we should have a check job that runs this target

Change-Id: I14c34c2ec8db73179964282cc95df96bd9a600fa

subject: Set Rabbit recovery method for network partitions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-28 02:53:12.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/rabbitmq_server/templates/rabbitmq.config.j2', 'playbooks/roles/rabbitmq_server/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Set Rabbit recovery method for network partitions

Adds configurable option rabbit_cluster_partition_handling with default
value of pause_minority. Allows option to be explicitly set to ignore
through Ansible to reset to prior (and RabbitMQ default) behavior.

Change-Id: I52625390b388a55c6ed210b5804c7de336985f37
Closes-Bug: #1454860
'}]
commit_message:
Set Rabbit recovery method for network partitions

Adds configurable option rabbit_cluster_partition_handling with default
value of pause_minority. Allows option to be explicitly set to ignore
through Ansible to reset to prior (and RabbitMQ default) behavior.

Change-Id: I52625390b388a55c6ed210b5804c7de336985f37
Closes-Bug: #1454860

subject: Allow configuration of Nova SQLAlchemy options
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-28 22:22:38.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_nova/templates/nova.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/os_nova/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Allow configuration of Nova SQLAlchemy options

Add variables for the following 3 nova.conf vars:
max_overflow (default 10)
max_pool_size (default 5)
pool_timeout (default 30)

This allows for sql tuning to better support bulk operations
(boot/delete) with the ability to define custom values in nova.conf
based on business needs.

Closes-Bug: #1447389
(cherry picked from commit 58212d9b8a7e692d49ae2852f349829355f93a2b)

Change-Id: I6f19c9e3a39979f6b78bdf86d9a06ce12aee7a7b
'}]
commit_message:
Allow configuration of Nova SQLAlchemy options

Add variables for the following 3 nova.conf vars:
max_overflow (default 10)
max_pool_size (default 5)
pool_timeout (default 30)

This allows for sql tuning to better support bulk operations
(boot/delete) with the ability to define custom values in nova.conf
based on business needs.

Closes-Bug: #1447389
(cherry picked from commit 58212d9b8a7e692d49ae2852f349829355f93a2b)

Change-Id: I6f19c9e3a39979f6b78bdf86d9a06ce12aee7a7b

It was using a non-existing method that did nothing and
that masked other problems with the tests that used it.
Changed to use assert_has_calls() and fixed the problems
that fell out.

Change-Id: I4a64c3365f9958b14c2384932a31da2ce191e2e2
Closes-Bug: 1426265
'}]
commit_message:
Fix dhcp _test_sync_state_helper asserting calls wrong

It was using a non-existing method that did nothing and
that masked other problems with the tests that used it.
Changed to use assert_has_calls() and fixed the problems
that fell out.

Change-Id: I4a64c3365f9958b14c2384932a31da2ce191e2e2
Closes-Bug: 1426265

object.  Oops.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-26 10:43:35.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/api/rpc/handlers/test_securitygroups_rpc.py', 'neutron/hacking/checks.py'], 'message': 'Remove use of contextlib.nested (api-tests)

Removed use of contextlib.nested call from codebase, as it has been
deprecated since Python 2.7.

There are also known issues with contextlib.nested that were addressed
by the native support for multiple "with" variables. For instance, if
the first object is created but the second one throws an exception,
the first object's __exit__ is never called. For more information see
https://docs.python.org/2/library/contextlib.html#contextlib.nested
contextlib.nested is also not compatible with Python 3.

Multi-patch set for easier chunks. This one addresses the tests from
neutron/tests/unit/api directory.

Line continuation markers (e.g. '\') had to be used or syntax
errors were thrown. While using parentheses is the preferred way
for multiple line statements, but in case of long with statements
backslashes are acceptable.

Partial-Bug: 1428424
Change-Id: I09673f9d4c7f07d3043804676fef018905dd1239
'}]
commit_message:
Remove use of contextlib.nested (api-tests)

Removed use of contextlib.nested call from codebase, as it has been
deprecated since Python 2.7.

There are also known issues with contextlib.nested that were addressed
by the native support for multiple "with" variables. For instance, if
the first object is created but the second one throws an exception,
the first object's __exit__ is never called. For more information see
https://docs.python.org/2/library/contextlib.html#contextlib.nested
contextlib.nested is also not compatible with Python 3.

Multi-patch set for easier chunks. This one addresses the tests from
neutron/tests/unit/api directory.

Line continuation markers (e.g. '\') had to be used or syntax
errors were thrown. While using parentheses is the preferred way
for multiple line statements, but in case of long with statements
backslashes are acceptable.

Partial-Bug: 1428424
Change-Id: I09673f9d4c7f07d3043804676fef018905dd1239

Images created for backup should be cleaned up to
conserve disk space on Fuel Master and reduce
the size of future backups.

Closes-Bug: #1437245

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-22 21:49:17.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_common_utils.py', 'neutron/common/utils.py', 'neutron/api/rpc/handlers/l3_rpc.py'], 'message': "Defer creation of router JSON in get_routers RPC

The get_routers method in the l3 RPC code has a log.debug
statement that formats all of the router data as indented
JSON. This method can be expensive if there are hundreds
of routers being synced and it happens even if debugging
is disabled since the function call result is the parameter
to the debug statement.

This patch adds and leverages a small helper class that takes a
callable and its args and defers calling it until the __str__ method
is called on it when it's actually trying to be rendered to a string.

commit_message:
Defer creation of router JSON in get_routers RPC

The get_routers method in the l3 RPC code has a log.debug
statement that formats all of the router data as indented
JSON. This method can be expensive if there are hundreds
of routers being synced and it happens even if debugging
is disabled since the function call result is the parameter
to the debug statement.

This patch adds and leverages a small helper class that takes a
callable and its args and defers calling it until the __str__ method
is called on it when it's actually trying to be rendered to a string.

Change-Id: I2bfceb286ce30f2a3595381b62bdc6dd71ed8483
Partial-Bug: #1445412
(cherry picked from commit 649599457e29b58ad0aec9ace990e0a2b59b05d0)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-24 01:46:16.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/common/test_ovs_lib.py'], 'message': 'Handle no ofport in get_vif_port_to_ofport_map

Newly added ports to OVSDB might not yet have an
ofport number assigned to them. This causes the
return from the DB query to return a list instead
of a port number.

This patch handles that by attempting to convert
each result into an integer and then catching the
exception and continuing through the iteration to
ignore uninitialized ports like these.

It also adds a unit test based on data from a
failure observed in the gate.

Change-Id: I5c1bc8363cc7b07a03df12e3ccd49a09b1907ad2
Closes-Bug: #1444269
(cherry picked from commit e7e2609fae70dbffa0ddbf37c7804587e216648c)
'}]
commit_message:
Handle no ofport in get_vif_port_to_ofport_map

Newly added ports to OVSDB might not yet have an
ofport number assigned to them. This causes the
return from the DB query to return a list instead
of a port number.

This patch handles that by attempting to convert
each result into an integer and then catching the
exception and continuing through the iteration to
ignore uninitialized ports like these.

It also adds a unit test based on data from a
failure observed in the gate.

Change-Id: I5c1bc8363cc7b07a03df12e3ccd49a09b1907ad2
Closes-Bug: #1444269
(cherry picked from commit e7e2609fae70dbffa0ddbf37c7804587e216648c)

commit_message:
fix network setup on evacuate

As reported in bug #1430042 when using evacuate + neutron virtual
machines fail to evacuate because of a failure to update port
bindings.  A similar issue applies to FloatingIP setup for
nova-network.

A related fix was proposed in
https://answers.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/nova/+question/257358
and seemed to be fixing users.

This handles things a bit differently in order to more cleanly
use existing code.

Change-Id: Iafa6d2e9eb76ea0389067c939f21ac2181df6f95
Closes-Bug: #1430042
(cherry picked from commit 7c81be3c2952f26e30bb8394c8e2803d31fc3b26)

commit_message:
Fix disk image create errors behind proxy

This commit fixes errors while trying to create a
DIB ramdisk with ironic-agent element when built
behind proxy. It fixes the issue by making it install
latest versions of pip and setuptools which has the
fixes for them.

Change-Id: I1ffb832ebab009b2d77a46e6c8fc758dd9632359
Closes-Bug: 1449852

commit_message:
Block allowed address pairs on other tenants' net

Don't allow tenants to use the allowed address pairs extension
when they are attaching a port to a network that does not belong
to them.

This is done because allowed address pairs can allow things like
ARP spoofing and all tenants attached to a shared network might not
implicitly trust each other.

Change-Id: Ie6c3e8ad04103804e40f2b043202387385e62ca5
Closes-Bug: #1447242
(cherry picked from commit 927399c011409b7d152b7670b896f15eee7d0db3)

commit_message:
Match order of iptables arguments to iptables-save

The way we were forming our iptables rules was not matching
the output of iptables-save. This caused the logic that preserves
counters to miss many of the rules.

This patch corrects the order for the comments and the allowed address
pairs to match the output order of iptables-save.

Closes-Bug: #1456823
Change-Id: I34c2249d0865485578767865c82414e1d813d563
(cherry picked from commit 12889f70e1ae547598f4c663e9da5b9bb03e347e)

commit_message:
Add policy to cover snapshotting of volume backed instances

This change adds a policy that can be configured to limit or prevent the
snapshotting of volume backed instances.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Id5486f3bb18c6431c4ae8def6540ba780ea15b0a

commit_message:
Process port IP requests before subnet requests

When a port requests multiple fixed IPs, process the requests
for specific IP addresses before the ones asking for a subnet.
This prevents an error where the IP that was requested happens
to be the next up for allocation so the subnet request takes it
and causes a DBDuplicateEntry.

Closes-Bug: #1459467
Change-Id: I645565c7fe0c47c58d686b25020bb49a0b9089f5
(cherry picked from commit 817b45b6406d9730859535ac54d73ec5c85451d0)

commit_message:
Process port IP requests before subnet requests

When a port requests multiple fixed IPs, process the requests
for specific IP addresses before the ones asking for a subnet.
This prevents an error where the IP that was requested happens
to be the next up for allocation so the subnet request takes it
and causes a DBDuplicateEntry.

Closes-Bug: #1459467
Change-Id: I645565c7fe0c47c58d686b25020bb49a0b9089f5
(cherry picked from commit 817b45b6406d9730859535ac54d73ec5c85451d0)

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-05-27 14:04:15.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/obj/test_ssync_sender.py', 'swift/obj/ssync_receiver.py'], 'message': "Remove _ensure_flush() from SSYNC receiver

The Receiver._ensure_flush() method in ssync_receiver.py has
the following comment:

    Sends a blank line sufficient to flush buffers.

    This is to ensure Eventlet versions that don't support
    eventlet.minimum_write_chunk_size will send any previous data

    ever gets released in an Eventlet version, we should make
    this yield only for versions older than that.

The reference pull request was included with eventlet 0.14 [1] and
swift now requires >=0.16.1 so it is safe to remove _ensure_flush()
and save > 8k bytes per SSYNC response.

commit_message:
Remove _ensure_flush() from SSYNC receiver

The Receiver._ensure_flush() method in ssync_receiver.py has
the following comment:

    Sends a blank line sufficient to flush buffers.

    This is to ensure Eventlet versions that don't support
    eventlet.minimum_write_chunk_size will send any previous data
    buffered.

    If https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/pull-request/37
    ever gets released in an Eventlet version, we should make
    this yield only for versions older than that.

The reference pull request was included with eventlet 0.14 [1] and
swift now requires >=0.16.1 so it is safe to remove _ensure_flush()
and save > 8k bytes per SSYNC response.

[1] https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/commits/4bd654205a4217970a57a7c4802fed7ff2c8b770

Change-Id: I367e9a6e92b7ea75fe7e5795cded212657de57ed

subject: Make SSYNC receiver return a reponse when initial checks fail
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 597, 'name': 'Pete Zaitcev', 'email': 'zaitcev@kotori.zaitcev.us', 'username': 'zaitcev'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 5600, 'name': 'Brian Cline', 'email': 'bcline@softlayer.com', 'username': 'briancline'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 14619, 'name': 'Victor Feitosa', 'email': 'victor.feitosa@lsbd.ufc.br', 'username': 'victorfeitosa'}, {'_account_id': 16233, 'name': 'Mauricio Lima', 'email': 'mauriciolimab@gmail.com', 'username': 'limamauricio'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-05-27 14:04:15.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/obj/test_ssync_sender.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py', 'swift/obj/ssync_receiver.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_ssync_receiver.py'], 'message': "Make SSYNC receiver return a reponse when initial checks fail

The ssync Receiver performs some checks on request parameters
in initialize_request() before starting the exchange of missing
hashes and updates e.g. the destination device must be available;
the policy must be valid. Currently if any of these checks fails
then the receiver just closes the connection, so the Sender gets
no useful response code and noise is generated in logs by httplib
and wsgi Exceptions.

This change moves the request parameter checks to the Receiver
constructor so that the HTTPExceptions raised are actually sent
as responses. (The 'connection close' exception handling still
applies once the 'missing_check' and 'updates' handshakes are in
progress.)

Moving initialize_request() revealed the following lurking bug:
 * initialize_request() sets
       req.environ['eventlet.minimum_write_chunk_size'] = 0
 * this was previously ineffective because the Response environ
   had already been copied from Request environ before this value
   was set, so the Response never used the value :/
 * Now that it is effective (a good thing) it causes the empty string
   yielded by the receiver when there are no missing hashes in
   missing_checks() to be sent to the sender immediately. This makes
   the Sender.readline() think there has been an early disconnect
   and raise an Exception (a bad thing), as revealed by
   test/unit/obj/test_ssync_sender.py:TestSsync.test_nothing_to_sync

The fix for this is to simply make the receiver skip sending the empty
string if there are no missing object_hashes.

Change-Id: I036a6919fead6e970505dccbb0da7bfbdf8cecc3
"}]
commit_message:
Make SSYNC receiver return a reponse when initial checks fail

The ssync Receiver performs some checks on request parameters
in initialize_request() before starting the exchange of missing
hashes and updates e.g. the destination device must be available;
the policy must be valid. Currently if any of these checks fails
then the receiver just closes the connection, so the Sender gets
no useful response code and noise is generated in logs by httplib
and wsgi Exceptions.

This change moves the request parameter checks to the Receiver
constructor so that the HTTPExceptions raised are actually sent
as responses. (The 'connection close' exception handling still
applies once the 'missing_check' and 'updates' handshakes are in
progress.)

Moving initialize_request() revealed the following lurking bug:
 * initialize_request() sets
       req.environ['eventlet.minimum_write_chunk_size'] = 0
 * this was previously ineffective because the Response environ
   had already been copied from Request environ before this value
   was set, so the Response never used the value :/
 * Now that it is effective (a good thing) it causes the empty string
   yielded by the receiver when there are no missing hashes in
   missing_checks() to be sent to the sender immediately. This makes
   the Sender.readline() think there has been an early disconnect
   and raise an Exception (a bad thing), as revealed by
   test/unit/obj/test_ssync_sender.py:TestSsync.test_nothing_to_sync

The fix for this is to simply make the receiver skip sending the empty
string if there are no missing object_hashes.

Change-Id: I036a6919fead6e970505dccbb0da7bfbdf8cecc3

Glance py27 tests are broken because test_opts loads the
entry_points and resolves the deps. Some deps (I think
stevedore's) conflicts with pbr 1.0.0 which released
recently.

This patch loads the entry_points with require=False.

commit_message:
Fix test_opts to not resolve requirements

Glance py27 tests are broken because test_opts loads the
entry_points and resolves the deps. Some deps (I think
stevedore's) conflicts with pbr 1.0.0 which released
recently.

This patch loads the entry_points with require=False.

Change-Id: I0f36faa60a4688c8aba5e31f69e3f1818adb681a
(cherry picked from commit 99826d08d4c48cb83f4c5eb7fc79bba9ffd86f41)

commit_message:
Renamed climate.conf to blazar.conf

Now Blazar uses as default config file blazar.conf. For backward
compatibility the old config file (climate.conf) is still supported, but
the values of blazar.conf taking precedence.
Updated some doc files to reflect this change.
Updated manually the tools/config directory.

Change-Id: I0c35a0d9508f76072b5510513f2f1ef83fb50fd6
Partial-Bug: #1311761

commit_message:
Integrating Blazar to Horizon

This is the first patch to integrate Blazar to Horizon.
The code is in Blazar client to avoid dependency issues (when the client
changes, our Horizon integration should change accordingly)
This integration is installed as new package called blazardashboard.

Change-Id: Ia65713550fe2b8caa321e204805ecccc3096cc2f
Implements: bp/climate-dashboard

commit_message:
Blazar Client support for API V2 version

Adding v2 package to climate client and also modifying the current
base client in order to support V2 operations.
Adding version discovery to Blazar client.

Partially implements: climate-client-v2
Change-Id: I995bdea717d0eddba47b8c5a091239be318387b7
Co-Authored-By: Pablo Andres Fuente <pablo.a.fuente@intel.com>

commit_message:
Modify endpoint for multiple version support

Modifying the reservation endpoint being registered on keystone
to support multiple version handling. The problem was that the
endpoint contained a hardcoded API version that needs to be
removed when v2 version usage is needed.
Partially implements: blueprint climate-client-v2

Change-Id: If2760c72444e3aec0a47feb0c11595c105bab063

subject: Extend PATH and set -o pipefail in linux ssh
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-04-24 08:39:42.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/utils/linux/remote_client.py', 'tempest/tests/common/utils/linux/test_remote_client.py'], 'message': 'Extend PATH and set -o pipefail in linux ssh

Some distributions have 'ip' utility in /sbin, and there's no link with target of /bin/ip
(CentOS7, for instance).
By this patch we
1) remove redundant specification: /bin is in PATH already
2) add /sbin to PATH, since SSH misses it by default
3) "set -eu -o pipefail" to make errors more explicit

Change-Id: I7693911e6b883a21baafe6f804564754ebaea5e0
'}]
commit_message:
Extend PATH and set -o pipefail in linux ssh

Some distributions have 'ip' utility in /sbin, and there's no link with target of /bin/ip
(CentOS7, for instance).
By this patch we
1) remove redundant specification: /bin is in PATH already
2) add /sbin to PATH, since SSH misses it by default
3) "set -eu -o pipefail" to make errors more explicit

Change-Id: I7693911e6b883a21baafe6f804564754ebaea5e0

commit_message:
Fix requirement conflict with flake8.

flake8 ==2.4.0 is incompatible with hacking, both 0.10.0 or 0.10.1
hard depend on 2.2.4, so we need a range until hacking has done
another release.

Change-Id: I1ad37d6c88b7b9fe50138f3248c609bfe8a5a123

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-05-13 09:54:52.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/filters/reserved_aggregate.py', 'doc/source/devref/filter_scheduler.rst', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_reserved_aggregate_filters.py'], 'message': "Create a reserved aggregate filter

This reserved aggregate filter only allows certain tenants to use hosts in
an aggregate that has been marked for their use. If a request has the
scheduler hint 'reserved_pool' the host will be selected if it is marked
with the tenant's id. If the hint is not present the host will not be
selected if it is marked with any tenant id, including the one in the
request. This has will allow tenants to have reserved hosts to use for a
specific purpose. The tenant may chose to put an instance in their
reserved pool or not - hence the hint.

Change-Id: I5aa8362293c88f9e10e1b9be8a02da4f2d0bc8f1
Implements: blueprint reserved-aggregate-filter
"}]
commit_message:
Create a reserved aggregate filter

This reserved aggregate filter only allows certain tenants to use hosts in
an aggregate that has been marked for their use. If a request has the
scheduler hint 'reserved_pool' the host will be selected if it is marked
with the tenant's id. If the hint is not present the host will not be
selected if it is marked with any tenant id, including the one in the
request. This has will allow tenants to have reserved hosts to use for a
specific purpose. The tenant may chose to put an instance in their
reserved pool or not - hence the hint.

Change-Id: I5aa8362293c88f9e10e1b9be8a02da4f2d0bc8f1
Implements: blueprint reserved-aggregate-filter

commit_message:
virt: make sure convert_all_volumes catches blank volumes too

convert_all_volumes would skip over blanks. This patch makes sure it
will consider them now too.

The patch (42ea00ee) that introduces the method for some reason
completely missed the Blank volume type.

Closes-bug: #1451950

Change-Id: I146a9bb09c149db1bab6dc13c082b00e5de8b764

subject: Fake missing local_gb for root_device_hint plugin
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-05-29 11:28:23.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_inspector/test/test_plugins_root_device_hint.py', 'ironic_inspector/plugins/root_device_hint.py'], 'message': 'Fake missing local_gb for root_device_hint plugin

At the first run of discovery, the RAID volumes might be missing from
the node. To avoid the standard plugin erroring, root_device_hint plugin
fakes the missing local_gb value. The fake value will be overwritten
with the correct one during later runs.

Change-Id: I2d38557fa356656e44e9915d3c4a5abb9cf1731d
'}]
commit_message:
Fake missing local_gb for root_device_hint plugin

At the first run of discovery, the RAID volumes might be missing from
the node. To avoid the standard plugin erroring, root_device_hint plugin
fakes the missing local_gb value. The fake value will be overwritten
with the correct one during later runs.

Change-Id: I2d38557fa356656e44e9915d3c4a5abb9cf1731d

commit_message:
Fix ansible-playbook segfault

ansible-playbook segfaults when we supply the "-I" option to pip.
Remove this option since it's also slowing down our run. See related
bug for more details.

Closes-Bug: 1459801
Change-Id: Idaf090d642c5e0ab5e143d824ca99f9d39679d87

subject: Configure computes after controllers
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-05-29 08:37:18.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml'], 'message': "Configure computes after controllers

Sometimes it causes problems when nova-compute is started before
nova-conductor. The nova-compute service doesn't register itself with
nova API and it loops these messages in the log:

2015-05-18 12:46:41.466 4085 WARNING nova.conductor.api [req-f72df90b-8e66-4e8b-8ec0-ba6362b83e61 - - - - -] Timed out waiting for nova-conductor.  Is it running? Or did this service start before nova-conductor?  Reattempting establishment of nova-conductor connection...

Nova-compute never recovers from this state unless manually
restarted. This causes the deployment to fail. To prevent this issue
from happening, we make the compute node configuration happen after
controller nodes have been configured.

Change-Id: I790e1d9f6c325af885edc86e5caa66a19398e712
Co-Authored-By: Jason Guiditta <jguiditt@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Configure computes after controllers

Sometimes it causes problems when nova-compute is started before
nova-conductor. The nova-compute service doesn't register itself with
nova API and it loops these messages in the log:

2015-05-18 12:46:41.466 4085 WARNING nova.conductor.api [req-f72df90b-8e66-4e8b-8ec0-ba6362b83e61 - - - - -] Timed out waiting for nova-conductor.  Is it running? Or did this service start before nova-conductor?  Reattempting establishment of nova-conductor connection...

Nova-compute never recovers from this state unless manually
restarted. This causes the deployment to fail. To prevent this issue
from happening, we make the compute node configuration happen after
controller nodes have been configured.

Change-Id: I790e1d9f6c325af885edc86e5caa66a19398e712
Co-Authored-By: Jason Guiditta <jguiditt@redhat.com>
